commit_message:
API: Raise up HTTPNotFound when no availabe while get_console_output

When we try to call get_console_output(), we may face console is not
available error, raise it up and let API raise HTTPNotFound error.

Closes-Bug: #1536513
Change-Id: I718d2168f353fb127a6d217b50fa595a66a1084a

commit_message:
Implement update_access() in generic driver + LVM

Add update_access() method to generic and LVM drivers,
to NFSHelper and CIFSHelper.

Remove allow_access() and deny_access() from helpers.

Partially implements bp new-share-access-driver-interface

Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Barbieri <rodrigo.barbieri@fit-tecnologia.org.br>

Change-Id: Ie34c92f8b9dc95d6af5cb150427503bf66543ab6

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-07 23:27:05.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_storwize_svc.py'], 'message': 'Trim 5s+ from storwize unit tests

The test test_run_ssh_fail_to_secondary_ip test case in the StorWize
Driver does a greenthread.sleep(random.randint()) inside a retry loop.
Its execution time often approaches 5s.

This commit mocks random.randint() in this test so that the
greenthread.sleep() duration is always zero, reducing execution time for
the test to under half a second.

The various test_storwize_consistency_group* tests trigger
FixedIntervalLoopingCalls.  Mocking them with ZeroIntervalLoopingCalls
reduces their total execution time from about 8s to under 3s.

We also fix the fake user and project ids in this file so that
it no longer emits FutureWarnings from oslo.versionedobjects about
invalid uuids as documented here [1].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField

Change-Id: I05dc3c4a5a886ce323430055f34d6c578c0f4443
'}]
commit_message:
Trim 5s+ from storwize unit tests

The test test_run_ssh_fail_to_secondary_ip test case in the StorWize
Driver does a greenthread.sleep(random.randint()) inside a retry loop.
Its execution time often approaches 5s.

This commit mocks random.randint() in this test so that the
greenthread.sleep() duration is always zero, reducing execution time for
the test to under half a second.

The various test_storwize_consistency_group* tests trigger
FixedIntervalLoopingCalls.  Mocking them with ZeroIntervalLoopingCalls
reduces their total execution time from about 8s to under 3s.

We also fix the fake user and project ids in this file so that
it no longer emits FutureWarnings from oslo.versionedobjects about
invalid uuids as documented here [1].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField

Change-Id: I05dc3c4a5a886ce323430055f34d6c578c0f4443

commit_message:
Pass new volume size when cloning (blockbridge)

When creating a cloned volume (using the Blockbridge driver), pass the
new volume capacity to the backend. After a successful clone, the
backend extends the new volume to the requested size.

Update unit test to ensure capacity param is supplied to the backend
API.

Change-Id: I5e9527691b4575e355143e61fd8ed0354ac2c3d9
Closes-Bug: #1554750

commit_message:
LeftHand: Create cloned volume didn't honor size

If the volume being created was larger than the cloned volume
the new volume was not being extended.

Change-Id: I65cbf76ca6c4b11b82cc992f731b868c511e653e
Closes-Bug: 1554746

subject: Renew subscription on update with TTL
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-11 04:09:27.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar/tests/functional/base.py', 'zaqar/tests/functional/helpers.py', 'zaqar/storage/mongodb/subscriptions.py', 'zaqar/storage/redis/subscriptions.py', 'zaqar/tests/functional/wsgi/v1_1/test_claims.py', 'zaqar/tests/functional/wsgi/v2/__init__.py', 'zaqar/tests/functional/wsgi/v2/test_subscriptions.py'], 'message': "Renew subscription on update with TTL

Now when we update subscription and specify TTL, subscription is not
renewed. It's life is not extended, and it's expiration date is still
old.

Because of that, it's impossible to extend life of subscription without
recreating it. But during subscription recreation some messages may not
be sent to subscriber, because there will be a moment when subscription
does not exist, which is bad.

This patch makes subscriptions renewable by PATCH method, when TTL is
specified in the body. In such case PATCH method sets subscription TTL
to a new value and sets expiration date to a recalculated value: current
time + TTL.

This patch also adds two functional tests for testing TTL-related things
in subscriptions. This increases functional testing time by ~2-4
minutes.

APIimpact
Closes-Bug: #1552866
Co-Authored-By: wangxiyuan <wangxiyuan@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Eva Balycheva <ubershy@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I048c37d6485ff27cf18ed27988874e470301fb57
"}]
commit_message:
Renew subscription on update with TTL

Now when we update subscription and specify TTL, subscription is not
renewed. It's life is not extended, and it's expiration date is still
old.

Because of that, it's impossible to extend life of subscription without
recreating it. But during subscription recreation some messages may not
be sent to subscriber, because there will be a moment when subscription
does not exist, which is bad.

This patch makes subscriptions renewable by PATCH method, when TTL is
specified in the body. In such case PATCH method sets subscription TTL
to a new value and sets expiration date to a recalculated value: current
time + TTL.

This patch also adds two functional tests for testing TTL-related things
in subscriptions. This increases functional testing time by ~2-4
minutes.

APIimpact
Closes-Bug: #1552866
Co-Authored-By: wangxiyuan <wangxiyuan@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Eva Balycheva <ubershy@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I048c37d6485ff27cf18ed27988874e470301fb57

commit_message:
Remove function service_to_db_user

Instead of generating database user names from the service name, use
variables such as KEYSTONE_DB_USER. This makes observing the use of the
names easier.

Since we are now passing an additional username argument to
setup_database, we can create create several databases under the same
username (required by Mitaka install-guide).

Change-Id: I7d3e66d7f9132a390a6b5acf7afd54e42dae64a4

commit_message:
Fix failure with rbd on slow ceph clusters

Make rados connection interval and retries configurable
for _try_remove_volume() function

Otherwise on slow ceph clusters, we can get following problem:

"ImageBusy error raised while deleting rbd volume. This may have been
caused by a connection from a client that has crashed and, if so,
may be resolved by retrying the delete after 30 seconds has elapsed."

Change-Id: I1230715663ea00c3eb4241154e6f194dee0e23d4
Co-Authored-By: Dirk Mueller <dirk@dmllr.de>
Closes-Bug: #1554045
(cherry picked from commit 66bd2b39d7490facc55dee3cab9523e8608fe491)

subject: Catch PortNotFound after HA router race condition
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14208, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'ml2.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ml2_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14212, 'name': 'Cisco Tail-f CI', 'email': 'tailf.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_tailf_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14213, 'name': 'Cisco N1kv CI', 'email': 'n1kv.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_n1kv_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14571, 'name': 'Intel Experimental CI', 'email': 'openstack-networking-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-networking-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15443, 'name': 'Cisco UCSM CI', 'email': 'ucsm.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ucsm_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-12 03:34:54.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py'], 'message': "Catch PortNotFound after HA router race condition

When neutron server deleted all the resources of a
HA router, L3 agent can not aware that, so race
happened in some procedure like this:
1. Neutron server delete all resources of a HA router.
2. RPC fanout to L3 agent 1 in which the HA router was
   master state.
3. In l3 agent 2 'backup' router set itself to masert
   and notify neutron server a HA router state change
   notify.
4. PorNotFound rasied in updating router HA port status.

How the step 2 and 3 happens?
Consider that l3 agent 2 has much more HA routers than l3 agent 1,
or any reason that causes l3 agent 2 gets/processes the deleting
RPC later than l3 agent 1. Then l3 agent 1 remove HA router's
keepalived process will soonly be detected by backup router in
l3 agent 2 via VRRP protocol. Now the router deleting RPC is in
the queue of RouterUpdate or any step of a HA router deleting
procedure, and the router_info will still have 'the' router info.
So l3 agent 2 will do the state change procedure, AKA notify
the neutron server to update router state.

This patch is mainly to deal with the race by catching the
PorNotFound exception in neutron-server side.

Change-Id: I34d7347595bfceb8a70685672a6287e1a44ede6b
Closes-Bug: #1533454
Related-Bug: #1523780
(cherry picked from commit 472d84d25cee0694500e583845718a4f377cc75c)
"}]
commit_message:
Catch PortNotFound after HA router race condition

When neutron server deleted all the resources of a
HA router, L3 agent can not aware that, so race
happened in some procedure like this:
1. Neutron server delete all resources of a HA router.
2. RPC fanout to L3 agent 1 in which the HA router was
   master state.
3. In l3 agent 2 'backup' router set itself to masert
   and notify neutron server a HA router state change
   notify.
4. PorNotFound rasied in updating router HA port status.

How the step 2 and 3 happens?
Consider that l3 agent 2 has much more HA routers than l3 agent 1,
or any reason that causes l3 agent 2 gets/processes the deleting
RPC later than l3 agent 1. Then l3 agent 1 remove HA router's
keepalived process will soonly be detected by backup router in
l3 agent 2 via VRRP protocol. Now the router deleting RPC is in
the queue of RouterUpdate or any step of a HA router deleting
procedure, and the router_info will still have 'the' router info.
So l3 agent 2 will do the state change procedure, AKA notify
the neutron server to update router state.

This patch is mainly to deal with the race by catching the
PorNotFound exception in neutron-server side.

Change-Id: I34d7347595bfceb8a70685672a6287e1a44ede6b
Closes-Bug: #1533454
Related-Bug: #1523780
(cherry picked from commit 472d84d25cee0694500e583845718a4f377cc75c)

commit_message:
Centos AFS rpm : copy to workspace

Copy the generated repo directly to the $WORKSPACE, rather than a
sub-directory, so the repo is just at

 http://tarballs.openstack.org/package-afs-centos7/

Also, the blank directory should not be necessary; we'll just copy a
blank $WORKSPACE

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-09 21:51:01.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_volume_rpcapi.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/services.py', 'cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/volume/rpcapi.py', 'cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': 'Switch failover-host from rpc call to cast

There is some concern that with large numbers of volumes it will be
difficult for drivers to failover the host before the rpc timeout hits.

To avoid asking admins to bump the timeout just for these cases we can
switch it to do a non-blocking cast instead of call. The difference now
being that the active_backend_id is not returned from the API call to
failover-host. An admin will have to look at the service-list output
to see when it has changed states from ‘failing-over’ and then check

Change-Id: I69b4908fe783cf785d3e1612422fca15fea01c6f
Closes-Bug: #1555342'}]
commit_message:
Switch failover-host from rpc call to cast

There is some concern that with large numbers of volumes it will be
difficult for drivers to failover the host before the rpc timeout hits.

To avoid asking admins to bump the timeout just for these cases we can
switch it to do a non-blocking cast instead of call. The difference now
being that the active_backend_id is not returned from the API call to
failover-host. An admin will have to look at the service-list output
to see when it has changed states from ‘failing-over’ and then check
what its active_backend_id is at that time.

Change-Id: I69b4908fe783cf785d3e1612422fca15fea01c6f
Closes-Bug: #1555342

subject: Remove use of LOG.warn().
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 18:59:49.000000000', 'files': ['networking_sfc/services/sfc/agent/agent.py', 'networking_sfc/services/sfc/drivers/ovs/driver.py'], 'message': 'Remove use of LOG.warn().

This fixes the pep8 job.  A new warning has been added about the use
of LOG.warn, as it is not Python 3 compatible.

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-03-10 08:49:51.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/objects/service.py', 'releasenotes/notes/scheduling-to-disabled-hosts-79f5b5d20a42875a.yaml', 'nova/db/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_service.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Add include_disabled parameter to service_get_all_by_binary

The database query service_get_all_by_binary should return a list
of services with the specified binary but it currently excludes
disabled hosts. This change adds a name parameter called
'include_disabled' which provides the caller with the option
of having disabled hosts returned too.

This query is used by the scheduler to retrieve the list of
available hosts. The initial list should include disabled hosts.
The ComputeFilter removes disabled hosts so inclusion of this
filter is the proper way to exclude disabled hosts.  Excluding
disabled hosts from the initial list prevents the forcehost
feature from being used to place an instance on a disabled host.

The query is only used in objects.ServiceList.get_by_binary which
is only called in one other place, in cells/state.py by
CellStateManager._get_compute_hosts. Adding the named parameter
to the get_by_binary method of the ServiceList class means the
behaviour of CellStateManager._get_compute_hosts will not be
impacted.

Change-Id: I05c2716da45119e6e6aa272b0701be9ae098842c
Closes-Bug: #1553099
"}]
commit_message:
Add include_disabled parameter to service_get_all_by_binary

The database query service_get_all_by_binary should return a list
of services with the specified binary but it currently excludes
disabled hosts. This change adds a name parameter called
'include_disabled' which provides the caller with the option
of having disabled hosts returned too.

This query is used by the scheduler to retrieve the list of
available hosts. The initial list should include disabled hosts.
The ComputeFilter removes disabled hosts so inclusion of this
filter is the proper way to exclude disabled hosts.  Excluding
disabled hosts from the initial list prevents the forcehost
feature from being used to place an instance on a disabled host.

The query is only used in objects.ServiceList.get_by_binary which
is only called in one other place, in cells/state.py by
CellStateManager._get_compute_hosts. Adding the named parameter
to the get_by_binary method of the ServiceList class means the
behaviour of CellStateManager._get_compute_hosts will not be
impacted.

Change-Id: I05c2716da45119e6e6aa272b0701be9ae098842c
Closes-Bug: #1553099

subject: Add functional convergence test for os-swift role
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-03-11 11:11:38.000000000', 'files': ['tests/inventory', 'tasks/swift_install.yml', 'tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml', 'tasks/swift_storage_hosts_setup.yml', 'tests/test.yml', 'tox.ini', 'meta/main.yml'], 'message': "Add functional convergence test for os-swift role

Adds a functional/convergence tests for os-swift including keystone,
galera, memcache and rabbit.

Swift testing infrastructure consists of:
1 service container /w keystone, galera, rabbit, memcached.
4 storage hosts (each with 2 disks)
1 proxy container.

This fixes a few issues to ensure the functional tests will run, such as
delegating sysctl net.ipv4.tcp_tw_reuse task to physical host, since we
are running swift storage inside containers for the purposes of this
test, and the containers won't have access to make this change.

Fixes the developer_mode settings which were incorrect.

Change-Id: Ie1dfaf666cbbac9fe78edd0a9218cec790c8c4d2
Closes-Bug: #1553967
"}]
commit_message:
Add functional convergence test for os-swift role

Adds a functional/convergence tests for os-swift including keystone,
galera, memcache and rabbit.

Swift testing infrastructure consists of:
1 service container /w keystone, galera, rabbit, memcached.
4 storage hosts (each with 2 disks)
1 proxy container.

This fixes a few issues to ensure the functional tests will run, such as
delegating sysctl net.ipv4.tcp_tw_reuse task to physical host, since we
are running swift storage inside containers for the purposes of this
test, and the containers won't have access to make this change.

Fixes the developer_mode settings which were incorrect.

Change-Id: Ie1dfaf666cbbac9fe78edd0a9218cec790c8c4d2
Closes-Bug: #1553967

Upon testing [1], I noticed that two of the four aodh-related services
were not starting.  These were:

- aodh-notifier

This commit updates the relevant files to reflect the correct names,

who has or is using aodh verify that I am not doing something

commit_message:
Update aodh alarm service names

Upon testing [1], I noticed that two of the four aodh-related services
were not starting.  These were:

- aodh-alarm-notifier
- aodh-alarm-evaluator

Upon looking at the binaries in /openstack/venvs/aodh-testing/bin/, I
noticed the actual names were:

- aodh-notifier
- aodh-evaluator

This commit updates the relevant files to reflect the correct names,
however I am not familiar with aodh in the slightest so suggest someone
who has or is using aodh verify that I am not doing something
completely incorrect here.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/291079/

Change-Id: Ideb5f54059cdea4f873ec37ea948fa3c4d874d3a

subject: Remove venv activation code
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-03 13:55:59.000000000', 'files': ['templates/horizon_django.wsgi.j2', 'templates/horizon-manage.py.j2', 'templates/openstack_dashboard.conf.j2'], 'message': "Remove venv activation code

This commit uses the pattern established in [1] to remove the venv
activation code by using the correct venv Python interpreter instead.

Note that using python-path in openstack_dashboard.conf.j2 does not
achieve full isolation from the host's python installation as we'd hope
(the path will still include /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages and
/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages), but every attempt at using
python-home failed due to the venv interpreter not being able to find
argparse.  We will need to spend some additional cycles here trying to
solve this as locking the venv interpreter into its own site-packages
is the best solution long-term.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/273943/

Change-Id: I0fbb8b9b070d1a0ab5cd55abfcc6587a0cd8957d
"}]
commit_message:
Remove venv activation code

This commit uses the pattern established in [1] to remove the venv
activation code by using the correct venv Python interpreter instead.

Note that using python-path in openstack_dashboard.conf.j2 does not
achieve full isolation from the host's python installation as we'd hope
(the path will still include /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages and
/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages), but every attempt at using
python-home failed due to the venv interpreter not being able to find
argparse.  We will need to spend some additional cycles here trying to
solve this as locking the venv interpreter into its own site-packages
is the best solution long-term.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/273943/

Change-Id: I0fbb8b9b070d1a0ab5cd55abfcc6587a0cd8957d

subject: register the config generator default hook with the right name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 20:51:05.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': "register the config generator default hook with the right name

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets this
application's defaults when the generator is run on a system with
everything installed (such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name
of the app instead, to ensure that the defaults are only set when this
app's sample config and documentation are being generated.

Change-Id: I6a8c7d44b9db9325003ff2fdb667b0ced7739e96
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
register the config generator default hook with the right name

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets this
application's defaults when the generator is run on a system with
everything installed (such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name
of the app instead, to ensure that the defaults are only set when this
app's sample config and documentation are being generated.

Change-Id: I6a8c7d44b9db9325003ff2fdb667b0ced7739e96
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

We need to become more diligent and rigorous about the options and/or
system behaviors that we deprecate. We need to watch for field's

commit_message:
Add deprecation tag

We need to become more diligent and rigorous about the options and/or
system behaviors that we deprecate. We need to watch for field's
feedback and ensure that we provide an alternative route once a
deprecation is followed up by a removal.

Right now, there's no way to have a comprehensive view of what has
been deprecated in a cycle and what removals have to happen. Adding
this tag is the first step to get this sorted.

Change-Id: Id25ed35c8a23c0e6f6fc1b47545c8d1bab3e8dc7

[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-03-10 02:48:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/personality.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_serversV21.py'], 'message': 'Set personality/injected_files to empty list if not specified

Previously, in the legacy_v2 controller, a "create" would pass an empty
list as a default for the injected files to the compute API. This
behavior has changed, and now, if no personality is specified, the
injected_files parameter ends up as None.

An empty list coming from the controller enabled us to inject files
through the hook mechanism. So, having this behavior changed,
breaks the functionality that was available through this, since we
now aren't able to use that parameter effectively.

Change-Id: Iac02c4ba23381889c36d897451b3e89756a75d4d
Co-Authored-By: Rob Crittenden <rcritten@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1518321
'}]
commit_message:
Set personality/injected_files to empty list if not specified

Previously, in the legacy_v2 controller, a "create" would pass an empty
list as a default for the injected files to the compute API. This
behavior has changed, and now, if no personality is specified, the
injected_files parameter ends up as None.

An empty list coming from the controller enabled us to inject files
through the hook mechanism. So, having this behavior changed,
breaks the functionality that was available through this, since we
now aren't able to use that parameter effectively.

Change-Id: Iac02c4ba23381889c36d897451b3e89756a75d4d
Co-Authored-By: Rob Crittenden <rcritten@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1518321

commit_message:
Fixing barbican TLS containers API misuse

1.Renaming cerificate manager functions. get / registrate / deregistrate are separated
2.Fixing mistaken cert files deletion in local cert manager when cert is invalid
3.Registering cert consumer only after successfull validation
4.Deregistering container cunsuming when cert is not in use anymore
5.Error handling changes, move exceptions to modules they belong to

Change-Id: I91de6a9b913fe4f95e9a90d2a9c36a487d82c366
Closes-Bug: 1514768

commit_message:
Revert "Zerofree the image if possible"

This reverts commit 5184d02a7c80cf4b2d2851695f0a205994129ef7.

The decision was made to go with fstrim because it is faster and more
universal that zerofree. The related-id has the patchset that implements
fstrim.

Related-Id: I269b4416be450369616f9b8e030f84c30e329804
Change-Id: If40cf2fc0ecd8686768cbfeac9ecee90907674e7

subject: register the config generator default hook with the right name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 20:30:38.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': "register the config generator default hook with the right name

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets this
application's defaults when the generator is run on a system with
everything installed (such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name
of the app instead, to ensure that the defaults are only set when this
app's sample config and documentation are being generated.

Change-Id: I6a8c7d44b9db9325003ff2fdb667b0ced7739e96
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
register the config generator default hook with the right name

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets this
application's defaults when the generator is run on a system with
everything installed (such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name
of the app instead, to ensure that the defaults are only set when this
app's sample config and documentation are being generated.

Change-Id: I6a8c7d44b9db9325003ff2fdb667b0ced7739e96
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Fix processing of libvirt disk.info in non-disk-image cases
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 20:49:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Fix processing of libvirt disk.info in non-disk-image cases

In Idfc16f54049aaeab31ac1c1d8d79a129acc9fb87 a change was made
that caused non-disk-image backends to fall over because of an
undefined variable because they skipped processing of the disk.info
file. This adds a check for that case to make sure we don't run
that path in the non-disk-image backend case.

Closes-Bug: #1555287

Change-Id: I02f8a5f0e29816336e500a8fe8dcc9ece15968e9
"}]
commit_message:
Fix processing of libvirt disk.info in non-disk-image cases

In Idfc16f54049aaeab31ac1c1d8d79a129acc9fb87 a change was made
that caused non-disk-image backends to fall over because of an
undefined variable because they skipped processing of the disk.info
file. This adds a check for that case to make sure we don't run
that path in the non-disk-image backend case.

Closes-Bug: #1555287

Change-Id: I02f8a5f0e29816336e500a8fe8dcc9ece15968e9

commit_message:
lbaas agent observes MTU settings used by subnets

The default MTU for the lbaas agent is the system default.  This is
incorrect for VXLAN networks that may be using a smaller MTU to account
for encapsulation.  The proposed fix is not complete, rather it shows
where and how the MTU adjustment may be performed.  (I don't where the
MTU is stored.)

Change-Id: I8ecd5f0dfa327b143fe50c9f9657dec68e57f43c
Partial-Bug: #1376446

commit_message:
register the config generator default hook with the right name

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets neutron's
defaults when the generator is run on a system with everything installed
(such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name neutron instead, to
ensure that the defaults are only set when neutron's sample config and
documentation are being generated.

Change-Id: I6a8c7d44b9db9325003ff2fdb667b0ced7739e96

commit_message:
Pass RBD order to clone call

For cloning of a RBD the rbd_store_chunk_size information from
the cinder.conf should be used to calculate and pass the correct
order information to the clone() call of the rbd library.

Added new test to check for correctly from rbd_store_chunk_size
calculated order while cloning.

Closes-Bug: #1489134

Change-Id: Ic5714d3e0d6961bce6ff588006661618130dca07
Co-Authored-By: Logan V <logan2211@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Danny Al-Gaaf <danny.al-gaaf@bisect.de>

__init__ module should be empty, so code from

commit_message:
Clean cleanup context

Modules rally.plugins.openstack.context.cleanup.manager and
rally.plugins.openstack.context.cleanup.resources were deprecated in
previous release and we ready to remove them, since the produce a lot of
redundant warning messages.

__init__ module should be empty, so code from
rally.plugins.openstack.context.cleanup.__init__ moves to
 -> rally.plugins.openstack.context.cleanup.admin (AdminCleanup)
 -> rally.plugins.openstack.context.cleanup.user (UserCleanup)
 -> rally.plugins.openstack.context.cleanup.base (base stuff)

Also tests.unit.plugins.openstack.context.test_cleanup is refactored too.

Change-Id: I25cf5750cb2de0d5652dc44db75818a5e10626eb

commit_message:
Add missing unit tests for L7 repo classes

This commit fleshes out the unit tests for the recently-added L7Rule and
L7Policy classes. While writing these unit tests, I realized with the
recently-improved l7policy sanitization / validation method that was
merged, the L7Policy update methods were doing work they didn't need to
be doing anymore. I have cleaned up the redundant code.

Closes-Bug: #1548905
Change-Id: I19a7fb6896bfec23b46594f694afb05393d95f93

commit_message:
Fix L7Policy update regression

It appears the improved L7Policy validation code recently merged broke
some types of L7Policy updates. This patch fixes this regression.

Further, the validations were reworked significantly since I had made an
incorrect assumption about which API parameters would be filled by the
l7policy API controller put method.

Change-Id: Ibd8723400d60e286e2704a8d52ac0baf582f38a3
Closes-Bug: #1555420

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-08 21:58:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/cmd/netns_cleanup.py'], 'message': "Don't emit confusing error in netns-cleanup

If we're trying to delete a dhcp/qrouter device with use_veth
= False (Which is the default for some time), we'll first
try to 'ip link del %s', which will fail and emit a confusing
error, then try 'ovs-vsctl del-port'. There's no need to
log an error in such a case.

The patch attempts to future proof by setting the
set_log_fail_as_error(False) to be as tight as possible, so we
do log errors in case the device is somehow used in the future.

Change-Id: I1954bde3ee9a2e43d7615717134b61c5fa7cfbb1
Closes-Bug: #1463800
(cherry picked from commit cfc9578148985f117c230be263d9faab4c1bb57e)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't emit confusing error in netns-cleanup

If we're trying to delete a dhcp/qrouter device with use_veth
= False (Which is the default for some time), we'll first
try to 'ip link del %s', which will fail and emit a confusing
error, then try 'ovs-vsctl del-port'. There's no need to
log an error in such a case.

The patch attempts to future proof by setting the
set_log_fail_as_error(False) to be as tight as possible, so we
do log errors in case the device is somehow used in the future.

Change-Id: I1954bde3ee9a2e43d7615717134b61c5fa7cfbb1
Closes-Bug: #1463800
(cherry picked from commit cfc9578148985f117c230be263d9faab4c1bb57e)

The HA router in master l3 agent will have high priority, which
will make this HA router instance to be the master instance in
the vrrp election.

The HA router in master l3 agent will have nopreempt=False. This
can make sure this HA router instance to be the master instance,

Partially-Implements: blueprint select-active-l3-agent

commit_message:
[WIP]Code change in l3 agent to consume master_l3_agent

The HA router in master l3 agent will have high priority, which
will make this HA router instance to be the master instance in
the vrrp election.

The HA router in master l3 agent will have nopreempt=False. This
can make sure this HA router instance to be the master instance,
when the keepalived rejoin the vrrp sync group.

Change-Id: Ia3d56f6e4853c71858c085e96cd6720bfebdf476
Partially-Implements: blueprint select-active-l3-agent

commit_message:
Enable SNMP support in keepalived

A lot of network monitoring uses SNMP. This patch will enable
an automated (or manual) query of keepalived state from a
remote box. This will enable integration with existing monitoring
systems.

Closes-Bug: #1460116
DocImpact

Change-Id: Iccf7e98192f2779c5032c3c18c53941e43aec8c1

We have a few cases where we use call when the other side
doesn't have a return value, nor do we handle errors / exceptions
that might result from the call. In these cases there's no reason
to use call, and we can use cast, which is substantially faster.

Change-Id: I58579a6c253abd40fc49bf0cb26b805b34fbc288

commit_message:
Change call to cast when recipient doesn't return value

We have a few cases where we use call when the other side
doesn't have a return value, nor do we handle errors / exceptions
that might result from the call. In these cases there's no reason
to use call, and we can use cast, which is substantially faster.

Change-Id: I58579a6c253abd40fc49bf0cb26b805b34fbc288

commit_message:
Utilize transactional execution of ovs port deletion.

This can significantly increase performance of operation
if python-ovs is used. Useful in netns-cleanup script
dealing with mass deletion of ovs ports.

Closes-Bug: #1529100
Change-Id: Ia4700e86d986e41b56fee89a5dd0c57d4a3b4096

commit_message:
Use os-client-config for common arguments

Rather than having explicit defines here in neutronclient, just use
the ones that are in os-client-config.

Change-Id: I8748d9cb54fed8b7a7ff0e82da99ab1484921a81

When using SR-IOV, unknown MAC address from VF goes to wire, not to PF.
This cause problem if SR-IOV VM need connectivity to OVS VM on the
same network and on the same host, because in this case the traffic
should be sent via the PF.

This patch update the ovs agent to add fdb entry for each OVS VM
MAC on the required physical networks.
The fdb entry tells the eswitch to send the trafic via PF and not
on the wire. Config option is added to ovs agent
to tell for what physical networks this is required.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1492228

Change-Id: Ia62f6742de661ddf6e9657e01ea5661cfa76d7f4
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Fix to allow SR-IOV and OVS VMs connectivity on the same host

When using SR-IOV, unknown MAC address from VF goes to wire, not to PF.
This cause problem if SR-IOV VM need connectivity to OVS VM on the
same network and on the same host, because in this case the traffic
should be sent via the PF.

This patch update the ovs agent to add fdb entry for each OVS VM
MAC on the required physical networks.
The fdb entry tells the eswitch to send the trafic via PF and not
on the wire. Config option is added to ovs agent
to tell for what physical networks this is required.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1492228

Change-Id: Ia62f6742de661ddf6e9657e01ea5661cfa76d7f4

Unit test made in such way, that it runs full IptablesManager stack and

commit_message:
Properly handle case when chain name contains colon

While applying firewall rules, some pre-existing chains may suddenly
disappear and changes will not be commited.  This is caused by a typo in
duplicate filtering code.

Use str.partition() instead of str.split() when extracting chain name and
stripping counters from iptables script.

Unit test made in such way, that it runs full IptablesManager stack and
checks that all pre-existing chains are preserved.  This is done because
a) duplicate filtering code is hidden inside _modify_rules method and
b) real problem is that pre-existing chains were not preserved, and this
is what needs to be tested.

Closes-Bug: #1510124

Change-Id: I70e2a6d8e2ce2d6489c26adccb527f2405383547

commit_message:
Display binding errors at ERROR level

It's an informative message and will help operators determine that an
agent is misconfigured without having to increase the logging level to
DEBUG in order to catch it.

Change-Id: I4b2891f7b8b87cabc2c184d8b6ad505fcf8f767d
Closes-Bug: #1523616

The goal is to simplify the L3 service plugin class hierarchy
a little bit. This patch removes the l3_hascheduler_db mixin,
and make L3_DVRsch_db_mixin inherit from AZL3AgentSchedulerDbMixin
instead.

I had issues with making list_l3_agents_hosting_router a module
level function because of cyclic imports, so I retained it in
the plugin, as part of the l3_hamode_db mixin.
get_agents_dict_for_router was used only in that function so I
made it a private function instead.

as a parameter.

Change-Id: I54649c6368ee62e71eb14a24b9c4666f293c9543
'}]
commit_message:
Kill l3_hascheduler_db mixin

The goal is to simplify the L3 service plugin class hierarchy
a little bit. This patch removes the l3_hascheduler_db mixin,
and make L3_DVRsch_db_mixin inherit from AZL3AgentSchedulerDbMixin
instead.

I had issues with making list_l3_agents_hosting_router a module
level function because of cyclic imports, so I retained it in
the plugin, as part of the l3_hamode_db mixin.
get_agents_dict_for_router was used only in that function so I
made it a private function instead.

The other two functions in l3_hascheduler_db are now module
level functions instead of class methods, and receive the plugin
as a parameter.

Change-Id: I54649c6368ee62e71eb14a24b9c4666f293c9543

commit_message:
Wrong usage of "a/an"

Wrong usage of "a/an" in the messages:
"Returns an neutron client"
"Updates a address scope"

Should be:
"Return a neutron client"
"Updates an address scope"

Totally 2 occurrences in python-neutronclient base code.

Change-Id: Ie6177f175491b27a90cf77689d01aec2419b09fd

commit_message:
Filter dvr mode l3-agent when neutron server schedule ha router to additional agent

when dvr mode l3-agent run sync_router, neutron server will bind ha router
to this agent if ha router hasn't reach max_l3_agents_per_router setting in
neutron.conf. This will cause ha router run in computer nodes.

Change-Id: I769b79bc7e53219cca1a416313cf4d50c1fb1b13
Closes-Bug: #1526175

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-01-05 14:29:07.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Allow to use system rootwrap

Tests depend on neutron-rootwrap installed in virtual environment.

neutron-rootwrap is provided by installing neutron with pip into
virtual environment. If neutron installed by any other means (OS
packages like rpm, deb) then it will fail to find neutron-rootwrap
executable and tests will fail.

The way to avoid such fail would be allow users to export variables
for thier own rootwrap deployed in the system. If user isn't
providing those variables, then the default values will be used.

This way, anyone who wants to run tests against deployed system
can do so, without depending on neutron installation in virtual
environment.

Change-Id: I9fbd24cc850fe9f0d56d246f5a5d18a8ecf4415c
"}]
commit_message:
Allow to use system rootwrap

Tests depend on neutron-rootwrap installed in virtual environment.

neutron-rootwrap is provided by installing neutron with pip into
virtual environment. If neutron installed by any other means (OS
packages like rpm, deb) then it will fail to find neutron-rootwrap
executable and tests will fail.

The way to avoid such fail would be allow users to export variables
for thier own rootwrap deployed in the system. If user isn't
providing those variables, then the default values will be used.

This way, anyone who wants to run tests against deployed system
can do so, without depending on neutron installation in virtual
environment.

Change-Id: I9fbd24cc850fe9f0d56d246f5a5d18a8ecf4415c

commit_message:
[WIP] One alembic env for all neutron projects [WIP]

Initially when services and sub-projects started getting split out of
neutron, each project was given its own alembic environment. This
prevents projects alembic migrations from being able to depend on each
other.

This change switches to supporting just one neutron alembic
environment. We need to update existing branch labels include the
project name.

Closes-Bug: #1497830

Change-Id: I9ed61fd8788edfb4b87c450a4eecfcc79b6df7b3

For DVR router, current code will try to adding floating IP address

router inherits this processing way from centralized router, but
with incorrect SNAT iptable rules for floating IP, it will cause

Change-Id: I4c5cb0fc40048f88f1a741269e84550adacc8eac

commit_message:
Remove floating IP address from DVR router device

For DVR router, current code will try to adding floating IP address
onto router_2_fip device in DVR local router namespace. DVR local
router inherits this processing way from centralized router, but
with incorrect SNAT iptable rules for floating IP, it will cause
issue [1] for DVR router.

The solution is fixing previous SNAT iptable rules and removing
floating IP addresses from router_2_fip device in DVR local router
namespace.

[1] a VM ping another VM on the same host with the later one's
floating IP address, but get replied by the later one's fixed
IP address. https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1462154

Co-Authored-By: stephen-ma <stephen.ma@hpe.com>
Closes-Bug: #1462154

Change-Id: I4c5cb0fc40048f88f1a741269e84550adacc8eac

commit_message:
Modified the configure_dhcp_for_network method

enable_dhcp_helper is prone to unhandled exceptions because of
configure_dhcp_for_network method.

This patch changes the configure_dhcp_for_network method to make it safer.
With this change, safe_configure_dhcp_for_network is redundant,
so removed it as it makes sense to have just one method instead of two.

Closes-Bug: #1495628
Change-Id: Ia9b1d19dd5b7c531fcfc669a341ff0eef2521c11

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-12-21 10:30:06.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/rpc/handlers/dhcp_rpc.py', 'neutron/agent/dhcp/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/api/rpc/handlers/test_dhcp_rpc.py'], 'message': 'Fix RPC timeouts seen in sync_state of DHCP Agent

- When an exception occurs while servicing a network, we schedule a
  resync for that network. However, when we are resyncing, we try to get
  the information of all the active networks(get_active_networks_info RPC)
  present at that point of time. When there are quite a few networks in
  the cloud, this RPC times outs(with the default rpc_timeout of 60secs),
  and its resulting in an indefinite number of sync_state calls down the
  line. There is no guranteed time after which the DHCP agent can get stable
  again.

- Both get_active_networks and get_active_networks_info RPC handlers
  call a helper method _get_active_networks. This helper method tries
  to schedule all the applicable networks before returning the requested
  information. This is a time taking process and more over, this is not
  required when we are intersted in syncing specific networks.

This patch attempts to fix the above gaps by fetching the network information
selectively instead of getting all the details all the while.

Closes-Bug: #1490308
Change-Id: If6df55df2a362813d63405beba62518f38841bff
'}]
commit_message:
Fix RPC timeouts seen in sync_state of DHCP Agent

- When an exception occurs while servicing a network, we schedule a
  resync for that network. However, when we are resyncing, we try to get
  the information of all the active networks(get_active_networks_info RPC)
  present at that point of time. When there are quite a few networks in
  the cloud, this RPC times outs(with the default rpc_timeout of 60secs),
  and its resulting in an indefinite number of sync_state calls down the
  line. There is no guranteed time after which the DHCP agent can get stable
  again.

- Both get_active_networks and get_active_networks_info RPC handlers
  call a helper method _get_active_networks. This helper method tries
  to schedule all the applicable networks before returning the requested
  information. This is a time taking process and more over, this is not
  required when we are intersted in syncing specific networks.

This patch attempts to fix the above gaps by fetching the network information
selectively instead of getting all the details all the while.

Closes-Bug: #1490308
Change-Id: If6df55df2a362813d63405beba62518f38841bff

commit_message:
Screen service q-lbaasv2 is not needed w/ octavia

The q-lbaasv2 screen service deployed by DevStack is not needed
when the Octavia driver is used. In README.md, the example used with
q-lbaasv2 should be removed to avoid confusion.

Change-Id: I7e72ad619263c06fb62faef1c2f68bce6e13a71b
Closes-Bug:#1516064

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-08 21:59:14.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/cmd/netns_cleanup.py'], 'message': "Don't emit confusing error in netns-cleanup

If we're trying to delete a dhcp/qrouter device with use_veth
= False (Which is the default for some time), we'll first
try to 'ip link del %s', which will fail and emit a confusing
error, then try 'ovs-vsctl del-port'. There's no need to
log an error in such a case.

The patch attempts to future proof by setting the
set_log_fail_as_error(False) to be as tight as possible, so we
do log errors in case the device is somehow used in the future.

Change-Id: I1954bde3ee9a2e43d7615717134b61c5fa7cfbb1
Closes-Bug: #1463800
(cherry picked from commit cfc9578148985f117c230be263d9faab4c1bb57e)

commit_message:
Don't emit confusing error in netns-cleanup

If we're trying to delete a dhcp/qrouter device with use_veth
= False (Which is the default for some time), we'll first
try to 'ip link del %s', which will fail and emit a confusing
error, then try 'ovs-vsctl del-port'. There's no need to
log an error in such a case.

The patch attempts to future proof by setting the
set_log_fail_as_error(False) to be as tight as possible, so we
do log errors in case the device is somehow used in the future.

Change-Id: I1954bde3ee9a2e43d7615717134b61c5fa7cfbb1
Closes-Bug: #1463800
(cherry picked from commit cfc9578148985f117c230be263d9faab4c1bb57e)

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-27 07:39:30.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/test_mech_driver.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_agentschedulers_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_dhcp_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/test_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/metering/test_metering_plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/services/l3_router/test_l3_dvr_router_plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/tests/common/helpers.py'], 'message': "Refactor: Tests and helpers should use existing admin_context when possible

Currently, helpers under neutron.tests.common.helpers won't accept an
existing admin context to use. Instead, they needlessly invoke
context.get_admin_context.

Tests that use the helpers mentioned above should use an already
existing admin_context. By doing so, we:
1. Guarantee all actions are being made under the same context
2. Significantly reduce the number of context.get_admin_context

Refactoring Done by the following logic:
1. common helpers should have the option to accept context. If context
was not provided, retain existing behavior and invoke get_admin_context.
2. tests helpers (under the same class, or inherited class) should have
the option to get context from the test. otherwise, use the common helper with
self.adminContext.
3. tests should, when possible, provide context to any helper used.

Change-Id: Ia09c2d404bf4761f69af720c30f5def1d78bf705
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor: Tests and helpers should use existing admin_context when possible

Currently, helpers under neutron.tests.common.helpers won't accept an
existing admin context to use. Instead, they needlessly invoke
context.get_admin_context.

Tests that use the helpers mentioned above should use an already
existing admin_context. By doing so, we:
1. Guarantee all actions are being made under the same context
2. Significantly reduce the number of context.get_admin_context

Refactoring Done by the following logic:
1. common helpers should have the option to accept context. If context
was not provided, retain existing behavior and invoke get_admin_context.
2. tests helpers (under the same class, or inherited class) should have
the option to get context from the test. otherwise, use the common helper with
self.adminContext.
3. tests should, when possible, provide context to any helper used.

Change-Id: Ia09c2d404bf4761f69af720c30f5def1d78bf705

commit_message:
Add check for assert(Not)In into hacking

We should use assert(Not)In(value, list) instead of
self.assertTrue(value in list) and self.assertFalse(value in list).
This patch adds check to detect these asserts.

Change-Id: Icd05d02a43d3703daa098545b704127b22179f2f
Related-Bug: #1218713

commit_message:
[WIP] Add IPv6 functional test-cases for dhcp-agent (OVS)

Added IPv6-version (DHCPv6 stateful) of existing functional tests
of dhcp-agent and refactored some functions related with this.
Work on DHCPv6 stateless tests in progress.

Partial-Bug: #1469065

commit_message:
[WIP] Add the use of ebtables command

The linuxbridge-dvr feature uses ebtables to manage DVR packet.
This patch restored from [1] in order to add the use of ebtables
for the packet filter.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/157634/

Change-Id: I5305034eeebd3100140c471662e1e437dfe299d5
Related-Bug: #1504039
Co-Authored-By: jbrendel <jbrendel@cisco.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-20 17:45:36.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/v2/base.py', 'neutron/db/ipam_backend_mixin.py', 'neutron/context.py', 'neutron/tests/api/admin/test_shared_network_extension.py', 'etc/policy.json', 'neutron/db/common_db_mixin.py', 'neutron/tests/etc/policy.json'], 'message': "Do not scope _get_by_id calls to context tenant ID

In our _get_by_id call we are currently scoping the database
queries to the tenant ID of the context. This makes it impossible
for other tenants to delete each others objects unless they are
an admin, even if policy.json allows it.

This patch adjusts the function to always use an elevated context
so it's queries will use the ID. The policy engine will still prevent
tenants from viewing/modifying each other's objects.

This patch also adjusts the delete_port policy to add an allow for
each field with policy enforced so it actually lets the request goes
through. Specifying this seems excessive so the enforcement of policy
on fields for a delete request should be revisited.

Finally, it enables the API test that was skipped because of this broken
behavior.

Change-Id: I920815a5c61df1d85664e14e1b9544795a922884
Closes-Bug: #1498790
"}]
commit_message:
Do not scope _get_by_id calls to context tenant ID

In our _get_by_id call we are currently scoping the database
queries to the tenant ID of the context. This makes it impossible
for other tenants to delete each others objects unless they are
an admin, even if policy.json allows it.

This patch adjusts the function to always use an elevated context
so it's queries will use the ID. The policy engine will still prevent
tenants from viewing/modifying each other's objects.

This patch also adjusts the delete_port policy to add an allow for
each field with policy enforced so it actually lets the request goes
through. Specifying this seems excessive so the enforcement of policy
on fields for a delete request should be revisited.

Finally, it enables the API test that was skipped because of this broken
behavior.

Change-Id: I920815a5c61df1d85664e14e1b9544795a922884
Closes-Bug: #1498790

commit_message:
Add check for assertIsNone into hacking

We should use assertIsNone(observed) instead of
assertEqual(None, observed).
This patch adds check to detect assertEqual(None, observed).

Change-Id: I0cfea74c04b90b006434e7f37ac99435b8dfb5aa
Related-Bug: #1503055

In order to support passive connection to IDL, we need to have the stream
object to be created by the agent, pass it to idlutils in order to get the
schema from teh OVSDB server, than leave it open for the agent to keep using it,
without closing the connection as it is done in then current get_schema_helper()
function.

Code snippet:

...
session = Session.open(self.connection)
helper = idlutils.get_schema_helper_from_stream_no_close(
        session.stream,'hardware_vtep')
helper.register_all()
self.idl = idl.Idl(self.connection, helper, session)
idlutils.wait_for_change(self.idl, self.timeout)
...

Change-Id: I011e359b5b4d2abbf9bd749df81b3bad3b800614
"}]
commit_message:
Add get_schema_helper_from_stream()

In order to support passive connection to IDL, we need to have the stream
object to be created by the agent, pass it to idlutils in order to get the
schema from teh OVSDB server, than leave it open for the agent to keep using it,
without closing the connection as it is done in then current get_schema_helper()
function.

Code snippet:

...
session = Session.open(self.connection)
helper = idlutils.get_schema_helper_from_stream_no_close(
        session.stream,'hardware_vtep')
helper.register_all()
self.idl = idl.Idl(self.connection, helper, session)
idlutils.wait_for_change(self.idl, self.timeout)
...

Change-Id: I011e359b5b4d2abbf9bd749df81b3bad3b800614

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary apply for iptables

The iptables rules will be applied within the defer_apply in
process_external. No need to explicitly apply in other place.

Change-Id: If0ee222c3632fc3895f369ac12147ae0cb8156f7

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-09-09 07:43:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/__init__.py', 'neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/securitygroup.py'], 'message': 'Support for --tenant-id in neutron security-group-list command.

In "neutron security-group-list --help", --tenant-id is not listed
as a supported argument. But when the command
"neutron security-group-list --tenant-id <TENANT_ID> is issued, it

to handle --tenant-id as a parsed argument rather than extra value.

neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/securitygroup.py

Closes-Bug: #1488912

Change-Id: I23f4a751a18dfeba365feafe73360bb8531773fc
'}]
commit_message:
Support for --tenant-id in neutron security-group-list command.

In "neutron security-group-list --help", --tenant-id is not listed
as a supported argument. But when the command
"neutron security-group-list --tenant-id <TENANT_ID> is issued, it
will list the security groups related to the given <TENANT_ID>
instead of throwing any error. As neutron security-group-list
currently supports --tenant-id as an extra value.

The changes included in the following files add --tenant-id to
"neutron security-group-list --help" and update the search_opts
to handle --tenant-id as a parsed argument rather than extra value.

neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/__init__.py
neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/securitygroup.py

Closes-Bug: #1488912

Change-Id: I23f4a751a18dfeba365feafe73360bb8531773fc

commit_message:
WIP lb: use vxlan_group from type driver

Use vxlan_group from ML2 VXLAN type driver and deprecate agent's
vxlan_group configuration option.

TODO: refactor CommonAgentLoop extracting RPC concerns so RPC interface
can be initialized before LinuxBridgeManager

Memoize vxlan_group as an IPNetwork object to avoid parsing IP address
string in each get_vxlan_group() call.

Remove no vxlan_group handling from linux bridge manager since
vxlan_group has a default and validation is now done at initialization
rather than first get_vxlan_group() call.

Refactor linuxbridge manager tests for invalid vxlan_group behavior
since this validation was moved into initialization for memoization.

Change-Id: I3e668cf8806b3b1e501abb277caec38d833c8944
Closes-Bug: #1523614

commit_message:
ml2: change vxlan_group default

Change ml2 vxlan type driver vxlan_group default to match LinuxBridge
agent default in preparation for deprecating LinuxBridge agent option.
Remove reference for using an unset vxlan_group value to disable
multicast support to ensure constancy with existing LinuxBridge agent
option.

This ml2 vxlan type driver configuration option is used anywhere in tree
today.

Change-Id: Ie54ef2b48ef727d2b229f7c09a86b325e7a1f165

commit_message:
Remove the pullup_route function

The pullup_router function should be removed,
I search the whole of the neutron catalog code,
but no other functions refer to it, and the decorative
message reminds: "Will be removed in the N cycle.".
So we need to remove the abandoned code.

Cleaned pep8 warning.

Change-Id: I36cff091b3122f5909740e76f1e829a05b3cc6b5

commit_message:
Return immediately if no agent be selected

if num_agents == 0 or hostable_agents == [] the
function should be return []. no need to call
select or bind.it can save time and avoid abnormal
 data pass other functions to cause possible problem.

Change-Id: Iff4a462f11d2999ac54d122a4ee7176efc299969

add maxconn to global option group

add maxconn number by user configuration
set default number is 2000 ,as haporxy used 2000 as default session limit
change unit test script for verify changed

commit_message:
Add unit tests for L7 data model additions

This patch adds unit tests for the data model manipulations which were
added in L7 and the subsequent model update flow fix and session
persistence update fix patches. While writing these unit tests, it
became apparent that we could simplify some of the logic in the L7
Policy data model update method-- so this has been done.

Closes-Bug: #1548944
Change-Id: I0df4e234e3383cf310d6169349844a344633ba1a

subject: libvirt: check for optional LibvirtLiveMigrateData attrs before loading
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14384, 'name': 'Quobyte OpenStack CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci-external@quobyte.com', 'username': 'quobyteci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16898, 'name': 'Virtuozzo CI', 'email': 'virtuozzo6-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'virtuozzo6-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-10 18:55:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/test_virt_drivers.py'], 'message': "libvirt: check for optional LibvirtLiveMigrateData attrs before loading

The _live_migration_operation method is accessing the nullable
attributes 'serial_listen_addr' and 'target_connect_addr' on the
LibvirtLiveMigrateData object which might not be set on the object.

Since they aren't lazy-loadable, this results in a NotImplementedError
if the attribute aren't set. This is fixed by adding conditional checks
in _live_migration_operation for the nullable attributes. Note that
bdms is nullable=False in the LiveMigrateDataObject and should be set
when the migrate_data object comes to the virt driver, so the test case
is updated in this case to fix the bdms attribute access.

There was a test hitting this, but because the libvirt driver runs
_live_migration_operation in a thread, the error was just being
logged and the test would pass.

So to fix that, the SpawnIsSynchronous fixture is used in the test
class to make the _live_migration_operation synchronous for that
test.

However, that doesn't fully resolve the gap in the test because
of the @catch_notimplemented decorator used on the test case. That
is meant for virt drivers which don't implement the live_migration
method but it can also allow silent failures in object attribute
access from bubbling up as failures. So this change also removes
that decorator from the test case.

Note that the tests themselves are pretty hacky in this case anyway
since while they are meant to be generic per virt driver, the
object passed down is LibvirtLiveMigrateData, which won't be
correct for xenapi, for example.

Closes-Bug: #1551925

Change-Id: I2744e99617d4e4834bb8372fa62dbad7686b1301
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: check for optional LibvirtLiveMigrateData attrs before loading

The _live_migration_operation method is accessing the nullable
attributes 'serial_listen_addr' and 'target_connect_addr' on the
LibvirtLiveMigrateData object which might not be set on the object.

Since they aren't lazy-loadable, this results in a NotImplementedError
if the attribute aren't set. This is fixed by adding conditional checks
in _live_migration_operation for the nullable attributes. Note that
bdms is nullable=False in the LiveMigrateDataObject and should be set
when the migrate_data object comes to the virt driver, so the test case
is updated in this case to fix the bdms attribute access.

There was a test hitting this, but because the libvirt driver runs
_live_migration_operation in a thread, the error was just being
logged and the test would pass.

So to fix that, the SpawnIsSynchronous fixture is used in the test
class to make the _live_migration_operation synchronous for that
test.

However, that doesn't fully resolve the gap in the test because
of the @catch_notimplemented decorator used on the test case. That
is meant for virt drivers which don't implement the live_migration
method but it can also allow silent failures in object attribute
access from bubbling up as failures. So this change also removes
that decorator from the test case.

Note that the tests themselves are pretty hacky in this case anyway
since while they are meant to be generic per virt driver, the
object passed down is LibvirtLiveMigrateData, which won't be
correct for xenapi, for example.

Closes-Bug: #1551925

Change-Id: I2744e99617d4e4834bb8372fa62dbad7686b1301

subject: Fix session_persistence deletion bug
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 11685, 'name': 'Stephen Balukoff', 'email': 'stephen@balukoff.com', 'username': 'sbalukoff'}, {'_account_id': 15226, 'name': 'Bharath M', 'email': 'bharath.stacker@gmail.com', 'username': 'bharath'}, {'_account_id': 16923, 'name': 'HP Octavia Sonar CI', 'email': 'octavia.sonar@gmail.com', 'username': 'octaviasonar', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-10 05:49:21.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/api/v1/handlers/controller_simulator/handler.py', 'octavia/tests/functional/db/test_repositories.py', 'octavia/common/data_models.py', 'octavia/db/repositories.py', 'octavia/tests/functional/api/v1/test_pool.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/controller/worker/tasks/test_database_tasks.py', 'octavia/controller/worker/tasks/database_tasks.py', 'octavia/api/v1/controllers/pool.py'], 'message': "Fix session_persistence deletion bug

Our code for updating a pool in the repository was off: You could
potentially update other pool parameters (ie. not session_persistence)
and it would unexpectedly clear the session_persistence. This patch
corrects this problem and cleans up the code dealing with session
persistence so that it's more understandable what it's doing.

There was also a bug in Neutron-LBaaS' handling of session_persistence
which was making troubleshooting this problem more difficult. This patch
is a prerequisite for the Neutron-LBaaS bugfix.

Beyond this, this patch also cleans up calls to
repository.update_pool_and_sp to not require the sp_dict parameter
(which, it turns out, did not need to be split out of the pool data
structure prior to calling this method anyway).

Closes-Bug: #1547157
Change-Id: Idcf12e463fbaa3a61a211f13986d8472f52036d2
"}]
commit_message:
Fix session_persistence deletion bug

Our code for updating a pool in the repository was off: You could
potentially update other pool parameters (ie. not session_persistence)
and it would unexpectedly clear the session_persistence. This patch
corrects this problem and cleans up the code dealing with session
persistence so that it's more understandable what it's doing.

There was also a bug in Neutron-LBaaS' handling of session_persistence
which was making troubleshooting this problem more difficult. This patch
is a prerequisite for the Neutron-LBaaS bugfix.

Beyond this, this patch also cleans up calls to
repository.update_pool_and_sp to not require the sp_dict parameter
(which, it turns out, did not need to be split out of the pool data
structure prior to calling this method anyway).

Closes-Bug: #1547157
Change-Id: Idcf12e463fbaa3a61a211f13986d8472f52036d2

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets this
application's defaults when the generator is run on a system with
everything installed (such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name
of the app instead, to ensure that the defaults are only set when this

commit_message:
register the config generator default hook with the right name

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets this
application's defaults when the generator is run on a system with
everything installed (such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name
of the app instead, to ensure that the defaults are only set when this
app's sample config and documentation are being generated.

Change-Id: I6a8c7d44b9db9325003ff2fdb667b0ced7739e96
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Fix processing of libvirt disk.info in non-disk-image cases
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 20:56:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Fix processing of libvirt disk.info in non-disk-image cases

In Idfc16f54049aaeab31ac1c1d8d79a129acc9fb87 a change was made
that caused non-disk-image backends to fall over because of an
undefined variable because they skipped processing of the disk.info
file. This adds a check for that case to make sure we don't run
that path in the non-disk-image backend case.

Closes-Bug: #1555287

Change-Id: I02f8a5f0e29816336e500a8fe8dcc9ece15968e9
"}]
commit_message:
Fix processing of libvirt disk.info in non-disk-image cases

In Idfc16f54049aaeab31ac1c1d8d79a129acc9fb87 a change was made
that caused non-disk-image backends to fall over because of an
undefined variable because they skipped processing of the disk.info
file. This adds a check for that case to make sure we don't run
that path in the non-disk-image backend case.

Closes-Bug: #1555287

Change-Id: I02f8a5f0e29816336e500a8fe8dcc9ece15968e9

Using the doc_values field storage format can result in dramatically
reduced memory usage at the cost of some disk space. This patch enforces

be overridden globally in configuration, per plugin via a property or

commit_message:
Set doc_values on field definitions

Using the doc_values field storage format can result in dramatically
reduced memory usage at the cost of some disk space. This patch enforces
what is the default in Elasticsearch 2.x. It does so by modifying the
mapping to add doc_values: True for appropriate field types. This can
be overridden globally in configuration, per plugin via a property or
for individual field types.

See
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/guide/current/doc-values.html

This is an alternative to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/287401/

Change-Id: I5e5fb880657fcab7223e0e5f7525aec07fbdf612
Closes-Bug: #1498995

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-10 21:37:57.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/exception.py'], 'message': "Allow recovering from an invalid failback command

If the driver determines the backend is not ready to be failed back,
there needs to be a way to keep the host's replication_status in a
failed-over state rather than forcing it into 'error' or 'failing-over'
state where it cannot be recovered.

Drivers should raise UnabableToFailBack in order to keep the host
failed-over so they can try again when the issue is resolved.

This patch also saves the hosts state in the event of UnableToFailOver
or InvalidReplicationTarget is raised.

Change-Id: Ie70fb296815db3056afc51e0c5403653962a567d
Closes-Bug: #1555814
"}]
commit_message:
Allow recovering from an invalid failback command

If the driver determines the backend is not ready to be failed back,
there needs to be a way to keep the host's replication_status in a
failed-over state rather than forcing it into 'error' or 'failing-over'
state where it cannot be recovered.

Drivers should raise UnabableToFailBack in order to keep the host
failed-over so they can try again when the issue is resolved.

This patch also saves the hosts state in the event of UnableToFailOver
or InvalidReplicationTarget is raised.

Change-Id: Ie70fb296815db3056afc51e0c5403653962a567d
Closes-Bug: #1555814

register the config generator default hook with the right name

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets this
application's defaults when the generator is run on a system with
everything installed (such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name
of the app instead, to ensure that the defaults are only set when this
app's sample config and documentation are being generated.

commit_message:
ODL v2: Security Group support

This commits refactors the Opendaylight security group code to handle
race conditions and out of sync issues. It attempts to address these
using an atomic thread synchronization model that tracks the sync,
retry, success and failed states of Neutron objects sent to Opendaylight.

Change-Id: Ia1742bfd30aeef0ad9216e4b02d6a97751b276c3
Partial-Bug: #1493551

subject: Make Nova scheduler filter work with Liberty
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 18:28:13.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/test_filters.py', 'tripleo_common/filters/capabilities_filter.py'], 'message': "Make Nova scheduler filter work with Liberty

It turns out that the semantics of getting to the scheduler hints
changed between Liberty and Mitaka, so the straight backport of the
scheduler filter doesn't work.  This changes the filter so it
accesses the scheduler hints in a way that is compatible with Nova
in Liberty.

Change-Id: I92c2f24bfb0e2dce147acafb88f756b529b0b48b
"}]
commit_message:
Make Nova scheduler filter work with Liberty

It turns out that the semantics of getting to the scheduler hints
changed between Liberty and Mitaka, so the straight backport of the
scheduler filter doesn't work.  This changes the filter so it
accesses the scheduler hints in a way that is compatible with Nova
in Liberty.

Change-Id: I92c2f24bfb0e2dce147acafb88f756b529b0b48b

commit_message:
Fix processing of libvirt disk.info in non-disk-image cases

In Idfc16f54049aaeab31ac1c1d8d79a129acc9fb87 a change was made
that caused non-disk-image backends to fall over because of an
undefined variable because they skipped processing of the disk.info
file. This adds a check for that case to make sure we don't run
that path in the non-disk-image backend case.

Closes-Bug: #1555287

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-11 17:56:01.000000000', 'files': ['manila/scheduler/filters/share_replication.py', 'manila/share/api.py', 'manila/tests/scheduler/filters/test_share_replication.py', 'manila/tests/scheduler/test_manager.py', 'manila/scheduler/manager.py', 'manila/tests/fake_share.py'], 'message': "Disallow scheduling multiple replicas on a given pool

Currently, while scheduling a new replica, the ShareReplicationFilter
passes any host that shares the replication_domain of the active
replica's host. On successive runs on the CI, it was observed
that the same host was chosen multiple times. In a real
deployment, there is no practicality in allowing replication
within the same pool.

Pass more information to assist the filter in disqualifying hosts that
already host replicas for the share.

Also treat NoValidHost exception differently from other scheduler

Closes-Bug: #1554282

commit_message:
Disallow scheduling multiple replicas on a given pool

Currently, while scheduling a new replica, the ShareReplicationFilter
passes any host that shares the replication_domain of the active
replica's host. On successive runs on the CI, it was observed
that the same host was chosen multiple times. In a real
deployment, there is no practicality in allowing replication
within the same pool.

Pass more information to assist the filter in disqualifying hosts that
already host replicas for the share.

Also treat NoValidHost exception differently from other scheduler
exceptions to be consistent with other scheduling failures.

Change-Id: Iedc7b752c7fc477d6257d100e2277378d59f1fde
Closes-Bug: #1554282

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-10 21:35:17.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/openstack/api_version_request.py'], 'message': "Use 'is None' rather than 'is_null()' in matches

Currently in the matches function for api versions the function
'is_null()' is called on both the min_version parameter and the
max_version parameter. However, these parameters are intended to
be strings, and there is no is_null function on strings so the
function results in an error. This patch changes them to 'is None',
since the is_null function is specific to the APIVersionRequest and
it's only checking if it's values are None as well.

Change-Id: I83ad6aa325650c50b1c0bae8b389370eff4238de
Closes-bug: #1555817
"}]
commit_message:
Use 'is None' rather than 'is_null()' in matches

Currently in the matches function for api versions the function
'is_null()' is called on both the min_version parameter and the
max_version parameter. However, these parameters are intended to
be strings, and there is no is_null function on strings so the
function results in an error. This patch changes them to 'is None',
since the is_null function is specific to the APIVersionRequest and
it's only checking if it's values are None as well.

Change-Id: I83ad6aa325650c50b1c0bae8b389370eff4238de
Closes-bug: #1555817

The infra scripts which handle translation support for horizon
was recently changed to remove horizon special handling.
As a result, file paths in POT files now contains module names

This commit update pybabel related functions in run_tests.sh
so that even when we run ./run_tests.sh --makemessages in

Change-Id: I32e83244e7fa3a4f6039573a97f1b0dca9fdd4c8
'}]
commit_message:
Sync paths in POT files with CI scripts

The infra scripts which handle translation support for horizon
was recently changed to remove horizon special handling.
As a result, file paths in POT files now contains module names
(openstack_dashboard or horizon).

This commit update pybabel related functions in run_tests.sh
so that even when we run ./run_tests.sh --makemessages in
local env POT files are not changed unexpectedly.

Change-Id: I32e83244e7fa3a4f6039573a97f1b0dca9fdd4c8

commit_message:
Migrate_repo init version helper

Helper function to determine init version for migrate repository. We
need single automated entry point to determine an initial versions of
repositories. Hardcoded and distributed initial version values could
contain wrong (for example old) value.

Co-Authored-By: Victor Sergeyev <vsergeyev@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sean Perry <sean.perry@hpe.com>

Closes-Bug: #1397903
Change-Id: I89616a2cf7a752fbe97591d5694b14f8b86e4539

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-03-11 12:51:20.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/v2/images.py', 'glanceclient/v2/shell.py', 'glanceclient/tests/unit/v2/test_images.py'], 'message': "Fix location update

After commit Ieb03aaba887492819f9c58aa67f7acfcea81720e, the command
location-update is totally broken now. This patch removes the updating
for an image from non-empty to empty since it's not supported now.
And also removing the default value of metadata for location-update
cli command because now the only purpose of location-update is updating
the location's metadata, so it doesn't make sense to give it a default
value which may update existing metadata by mistake.

Closes-Bug: #1537626

Change-Id: I9ce98e6c63996bbfdbc56761055e37a871f9d3e2
"}]
commit_message:
Fix location update

After commit Ieb03aaba887492819f9c58aa67f7acfcea81720e, the command
location-update is totally broken now. This patch removes the updating
for an image from non-empty to empty since it's not supported now.
And also removing the default value of metadata for location-update
cli command because now the only purpose of location-update is updating
the location's metadata, so it doesn't make sense to give it a default
value which may update existing metadata by mistake.

Closes-Bug: #1537626

Change-Id: I9ce98e6c63996bbfdbc56761055e37a871f9d3e2

commit_message:
Install master's version of an RDO keystone

RDO isn't moving for approxximately 1 week new packages into
current-passed-ci.  This blocks Sam's keystone bootstrap patch.

To unblock this, we temporarily have provided copr built RPMs
based upon the srpm from RDO and keystone-master tarball.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ic0fe30c56e8dd229f2a25157125272324621bad9

commit_message:
Configure nova to use custom scheduler filter

The dependency adds a new scheduler filter that is required for
predictable placement of nodes.  This simply configures Nova to
use the new filter.

Change-Id: Ie25d2aacf3b496fd5f02071adc5b2e09e37a8684
Depends-On: I92c2f24bfb0e2dce147acafb88f756b529b0b48b
