commit_message:
Workaround debug DuplicateOptError with generator

The oslo-config-generator error is caused by including
oslo.middleware.cors in the generator file.  A workaround for
bringing in same named options twice is to ensure Oslo Log incubator
options attributes match those of Oslo Log.

Change-Id: I11b9b29d186e4ea33e0559264c42c5008a2ccbcd
Related-Bug: #1555788

commit_message:
Fix PUT tag failure

This patch fix failure putting tag on network.
Timestamp causes the issue because it try to update 'updated_at'
of tag which doesn't have the attribute.

Change-Id: Iad088bbaf4b05a25153964ed30762b70fc8b3318
Closes-Bug: #1555686

commit_message:
DON'T MERGE Remove allow_overlapping_ips

I'm just pushing this up to see what breaks by taking this out (if
anything).  Also, to collect feedback on the idea of deprecating and
removing it.  If we do decide to remove this it should be properly
deprecated and removed a release later, not like this.  So, if I move
forward I'll do it properly.

Seems to me like we have overlapping IP capability everywhere.  What
prevents us from removing this?  This has been brought up at least
once on the mailing list [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-May/036336.html

Change-Id: I473540b750f35603914b8afeb8166f723faf709d
Related-Bug: #1438320

subject: register the config generator default hook with the right name
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-11 20:49:11.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': "register the config generator default hook with the right name

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets this
application's defaults when the generator is run on a system with
everything installed (such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name
of the app instead, to ensure that the defaults are only set when this
app's sample config and documentation are being generated.

Change-Id: I6a8c7d44b9db9325003ff2fdb667b0ced7739e96
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
register the config generator default hook with the right name

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets this
application's defaults when the generator is run on a system with
everything installed (such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name
of the app instead, to ensure that the defaults are only set when this
app's sample config and documentation are being generated.

Change-Id: I6a8c7d44b9db9325003ff2fdb667b0ced7739e96
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Move replication volume manager warnings to info

These two messages are printing at the warning level
when starting c-vol.

Since these don't seem to be something that demands
attention, they should be logged at a lower level.

subject: Remove config generation pylxd hard dependency
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2417, 'name': 'Ben Swartzlander', 'email': 'ben@swartzlander.org', 'username': 'bswartz'}, {'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 15942, 'name': 'Dell EMC Isilon CI', 'email': 'emc.isilon.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'e', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 17565, 'name': 'IBM GPFS CI', 'email': 'imanilac@in.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmmanilaci'}, {'_account_id': 18128, 'name': 'Microsoft Manila CI', 'email': 'Microsoft_Manila_CI@microsoft.com', 'username': 'microsoft_manila_ci'}, {'_account_id': 18752, 'name': 'Tegile Storage CI', 'email': 'openstack.ci@tegile.com', 'username': 'tegile', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-04 20:25:01.000000000', 'files': ['manila/opts.py'], 'message': 'Remove config generation pylxd hard dependency

Since the introduction of the LXD/LXC first-party manila driver [1],
config generation for manila via oslo-condig-generator fails unless
pylxd is installed on the system. This is likely an unwanted dependency
as it is problematic for distributions that do not include LXD and which
will not therefore distribute a packaged version of pylxd.

manila/opts.py currently does an unconditional import of
manila/share/drivers/lxd.  This commit makes the import and accompanying
option processing conditional on the presence of the pylxd module on
the system generating the config.

[1] commit 4f74b224fad7bf9ca665d70a66c79c98cf8d5674

Change-Id: I6bbc922435b9650a6b1cc4a19b15a61b1f617784
Closes-bug: #1553208
'}]
commit_message:
Remove config generation pylxd hard dependency

Since the introduction of the LXD/LXC first-party manila driver [1],
config generation for manila via oslo-condig-generator fails unless
pylxd is installed on the system. This is likely an unwanted dependency
as it is problematic for distributions that do not include LXD and which
will not therefore distribute a packaged version of pylxd.

manila/opts.py currently does an unconditional import of
manila/share/drivers/lxd.  This commit makes the import and accompanying
option processing conditional on the presence of the pylxd module on
the system generating the config.

[1] commit 4f74b224fad7bf9ca665d70a66c79c98cf8d5674

Change-Id: I6bbc922435b9650a6b1cc4a19b15a61b1f617784
Closes-bug: #1553208

subject: Add ability to set IPv6 routes in os-net-config templates
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 12398, 'name': 'Dan Sneddon', 'email': 'dsneddon@redhat.com', 'username': 'dsneddon'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-11 18:24:46.000000000', 'files': ['os_net_config/tests/test_impl_ifcfg.py', 'os_net_config/impl_ifcfg.py'], 'message': 'Add ability to set IPv6 routes in os-net-config templates

This change adds the ability to write IPv6 routes to the system
NIC configuration. In the ifcfg provider, IPv6 routes must be
written to network-scripts/route6-<interface> rather than
route-interface. This patch checks the next hop, and if it is an
IPv6 address (assumed because of the presence of ":"), then the
route will be written to route6-<interface>. This patch includes
tests to confirm proper operation.

Change-Id: I3563800c774a6082a896c7508f5a92e25418fe63
'}]
commit_message:
Add ability to set IPv6 routes in os-net-config templates

This change adds the ability to write IPv6 routes to the system
NIC configuration. In the ifcfg provider, IPv6 routes must be
written to network-scripts/route6-<interface> rather than
route-interface. This patch checks the next hop, and if it is an
IPv6 address (assumed because of the presence of ":"), then the
route will be written to route6-<interface>. This patch includes
tests to confirm proper operation.

Change-Id: I3563800c774a6082a896c7508f5a92e25418fe63

subject: Use the retry decorator for methods adding/removing virt res
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-07 13:11:01.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/utils/jobutils.py'], 'message': 'Use the retry decorator for methods adding/removing virt res

In some cases, the add_virt_resource method fails because of what
seems to be a Hyper-V race condtion.

This change adds a retry decorator for this method, as well as the
one removing virt resources.

Change-Id: Ib526181b95ed84bdbc755e549a960ab2ca8d285c
'}]
commit_message:
Use the retry decorator for methods adding/removing virt res

In some cases, the add_virt_resource method fails because of what
seems to be a Hyper-V race condtion.

This change adds a retry decorator for this method, as well as the
one removing virt resources.

Change-Id: Ib526181b95ed84bdbc755e549a960ab2ca8d285c

subject: register the config generator default hook with the right name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 20:32:40.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': "register the config generator default hook with the right name

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets this
application's defaults when the generator is run on a system with
everything installed (such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name
of the app instead, to ensure that the defaults are only set when this
app's sample config and documentation are being generated.

Change-Id: I6a8c7d44b9db9325003ff2fdb667b0ced7739e96
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
register the config generator default hook with the right name

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets this
application's defaults when the generator is run on a system with
everything installed (such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name
of the app instead, to ensure that the defaults are only set when this
app's sample config and documentation are being generated.

Change-Id: I6a8c7d44b9db9325003ff2fdb667b0ced7739e96
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Decouple ceilometerclient without aodh services running

Currently, the ceilometerclient will be broken if aodh services not
running, it will be worse if users don't want alarming service and they
must start the aodh services.

Change-Id: Idf7468f28cee001262b67b6e110357ffc971535a
Closes-Bug: #1550095
(cherry picked from commit 78869fbccaffdf625fc1ec4ed3108bb7de892720)

meters.

This patch enhances the ceilometer-client to support
the unique argument in the shell and the client bindings.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1506959

Change-Id: I011ca725c25e1cdbe9891c3719f13f5cd34142ea

commit_message:
Enhances client to support unique meter retrieval

meter list API is enhanced to support a unique param
If specified as True, it returns a unique list of
meters.

This patch enhances the ceilometer-client to support
the unique argument in the shell and the client bindings.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1506959

Change-Id: I011ca725c25e1cdbe9891c3719f13f5cd34142ea
(cherry picked from commit c45000c7594ad6fbfabf44c0615dce3021f43605)

subject: Add missing unit test for clean_command and fix error handling
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 17:06:19.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tests/cmd/test_db_cleanup.py', 'barbican/model/clean.py'], 'message': 'Add missing unit test for clean_command and fix error handling

The clean_command in barbican/model/clean.py is missing
a unit test for coverage. Unit tests have been added.

There was a redundant log exception that was removed.
A check for a successfull exit was removed because there are no
apparent exceptions that raise successfull exits during clean up.

Closes-Bug: #1555182
Change-Id: Ia1e1fe07dc9081b20c5fb0bad1a979809db0be4a
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing unit test for clean_command and fix error handling

The clean_command in barbican/model/clean.py is missing
a unit test for coverage. Unit tests have been added.

There was a redundant log exception that was removed.
A check for a successfull exit was removed because there are no
apparent exceptions that raise successfull exits during clean up.

Closes-Bug: #1555182
Change-Id: Ia1e1fe07dc9081b20c5fb0bad1a979809db0be4a

subject: Add missing delay-release option in Fuel projects
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-11 19:22:24.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/projects.yaml'], 'message': "Add missing delay-release option in Fuel projects

By default if patch with Closes-Bug tag gets merged, bot changes bug
status to Fix Released.

We need a 'delay-release' option, so that bug will be moved to Fix
Commited state and then will be verified manually.

Change-Id: I90ced5a0643eaf9b9a2c2df530c25ed3b098c4a7
"}]
commit_message:
Add missing delay-release option in Fuel projects

By default if patch with Closes-Bug tag gets merged, bot changes bug
status to Fix Released.

We need a 'delay-release' option, so that bug will be moved to Fix
Commited state and then will be verified manually.

Change-Id: I90ced5a0643eaf9b9a2c2df530c25ed3b098c4a7

commit_message:
Fix programmatic error in heartbeat()

This patch is fixing a programmatic error in the heartbeat() method of
the APIClient() class. When 409 (Conflict) was returned from the the
Ironic API the code wasn't parsing the content of the response
correctly.

Change-Id: I01fbb8d866b2f94fe128d0bc40b69d05b5add1a3
Closes-Bug: #1556199

The cliff module expects an array of tuples however
the array that this function was returning was an array
of tuples that was also containing an array of values for

The output now comes out looking like:

commit_message:
Fixed command list

The cliff module expects an array of tuples however
the array that this function was returning was an array
of tuples that was also containing an array of values for
the commands attached to each group and the
cliff module wasn't liking it.

The output now comes out looking like:

| openstack.common | limits show |
|                  | extension list |
| openstack.baremetal.v1 | baremetal set |

Change-Id: Ifa1c149cb5c66ba27dc72bf72d7c8f2f50e42f73
Closes-Bug: 1545609

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 11:24:02.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ironic.yaml'], 'message': 'enable stack sudo for ironic discovery gate job

discovery_exercise.sh performs two steps that require superuser privileges:
* iptables -L ironic-inspector to confirm a node is not blacklisted before
  booting it for the discovery process
* virsh start <baremetal_domain> to trigger the discovery process of a node

This patch changes safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh behavior to avoid dropping
stack user from sudoers.d Similar approach has already been applied in case
of the nodepool.yaml set of jobs[1]

Links:
[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/master/jenkins/jobs/nodepool.yaml#L77

Change-Id: I69fb19f4baa0ae433ac53a4384992ee6a9d3ba65
'}]
commit_message:
enable stack sudo for ironic discovery gate job

discovery_exercise.sh performs two steps that require superuser privileges:
* iptables -L ironic-inspector to confirm a node is not blacklisted before
  booting it for the discovery process
* virsh start <baremetal_domain> to trigger the discovery process of a node

This patch changes safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh behavior to avoid dropping
stack user from sudoers.d Similar approach has already been applied in case
of the nodepool.yaml set of jobs[1]

Links:
[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/master/jenkins/jobs/nodepool.yaml#L77

Change-Id: I69fb19f4baa0ae433ac53a4384992ee6a9d3ba65

subject: Remove unnecessary check for tenant information
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-10 00:56:09.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/shell.py'], 'message': 'Remove unnecessary check for tenant information

Keystone v3 has changed the name of tenants to projects which means that
OS_TENANT_NAME is meaningless in a cloud where v3 is the default
authentication version. As such, if a user does not have OS_TENANT_NAME
enabled, cinderclient will not work even though it has checks for v3
immediately below this check (and the same check replicated further
below that). Removing this allows cinderclient to work with Keystone v3
without setting OS_TENANT_NAME unnecessarily.

Further, the check for project information was incorrectly referring to
project_domain_name and project_domain_id instead of
os_project_domain_name and os_project_domain_id.

Closes-bug: 1472636
Change-Id: Ifabb4a2aec070c00349e794364a71394feea99f1
(cherry picked from commit 8afc06c562ac8c189fae6ded7cc50f1b579f06c4)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary check for tenant information

Keystone v3 has changed the name of tenants to projects which means that
OS_TENANT_NAME is meaningless in a cloud where v3 is the default
authentication version. As such, if a user does not have OS_TENANT_NAME
enabled, cinderclient will not work even though it has checks for v3
immediately below this check (and the same check replicated further
below that). Removing this allows cinderclient to work with Keystone v3
without setting OS_TENANT_NAME unnecessarily.

Further, the check for project information was incorrectly referring to
project_domain_name and project_domain_id instead of
os_project_domain_name and os_project_domain_id.

Closes-bug: 1472636
Change-Id: Ifabb4a2aec070c00349e794364a71394feea99f1
(cherry picked from commit 8afc06c562ac8c189fae6ded7cc50f1b579f06c4)

subject: Add __setitem__ to ImageTarget policy wrapper
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-17 20:55:13.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/test_policy.py', 'glance/api/policy.py'], 'message': 'Add __setitem__ to ImageTarget policy wrapper

Certain code paths expect that an ImageTarget class will use __setitem__ (as
it supports __getitem__) to set attributes on the target object. Since the
object does not presently support that, 500 exceptions are returned to users.

Closes-bug: 1533270
Closes-bug: 1533150
Change-Id: I41a618e096e458ec45c290b6412d67f215237f26
'}]
commit_message:
Add __setitem__ to ImageTarget policy wrapper

Certain code paths expect that an ImageTarget class will use __setitem__ (as
it supports __getitem__) to set attributes on the target object. Since the
object does not presently support that, 500 exceptions are returned to users.

Closes-bug: 1533270
Closes-bug: 1533150
Change-Id: I41a618e096e458ec45c290b6412d67f215237f26

commit_message:
Missing info_cache.save() in db sqlalchemy api

'instance_info_cache_update' method is actually 'update_or_create'
method, so 'save' method is needed to add new value to the DB.

Closes-Bug: #1378459

Co-Authored-By: Sergey Nikitin <snikitin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nathanael I Burton <nathanael.i.burton.work@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Iab845de66b3cbb851134d9acb7b16c1b831d2bd4

commit_message:
Test no quota tests

Quota tests cause neutron to create new networks, which
wreaks havoc with the ZFS and LVM drivers because mounted
filesystems end up being stuck in other mount namespaces
created by neutron.

Depends-On: Ib1896997f2e7a505b5bf8ec0c9e5ee35942f79a6
Change-Id: I420cb60913e512527b23ef78b22cf834c660a4a4

commit_message:
Add backwards compat for server_kwargs name change

9eb7f644 changed the 'server_kwargs' argument of
boot_and_delete_server_with_keypair to 'boot_server_kwargs', but
didn't add any backwards compatibility for it. This adds the necessary
compatibility in order to avoid breaking that scenario outright.

Change-Id: I1083a48d2f0cfbedb8dc35df475857313fabfd8d

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 2799, 'name': 'Andy McCrae', 'email': 'andy.mccrae@googlemail.com', 'username': 'andrew-mccrae'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20084, 'name': 'Intel networking-odl CI', 'email': 'intel-odl-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-networking-odl-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-08 01:05:42.000000000', 'files': ['lib/swift'], 'message': 'Set the Swift max_file_size to 1/2 the loopback

Currently Devstack (and devstack gate) uses the default
max_file_size of for Swift (5GB). However the loopback file
is only 1 or 2 GB is size.

We are looking at setting a default FALLOCATE_RESERVE in swift
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/288011.
Because of this our max file size test fails due to the max_file_size
and devstacks loopback size being too small.

This patch sets this to a more sane size by default inside DevStack.
See the gerrit link above for more details.

Tempest uses a loopback of 6GB, so in this case the swift default of 5GB
should be fine.

Change-Id: If09eab7d16ae67bd252020e00e8812ff252f065b
'}]
commit_message:
Set the Swift max_file_size to 1/2 the loopback

Currently Devstack (and devstack gate) uses the default
max_file_size of for Swift (5GB). However the loopback file
is only 1 or 2 GB is size.

We are looking at setting a default FALLOCATE_RESERVE in swift
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/288011.
Because of this our max file size test fails due to the max_file_size
and devstacks loopback size being too small.

This patch sets this to a more sane size by default inside DevStack.
See the gerrit link above for more details.

Tempest uses a loopback of 6GB, so in this case the swift default of 5GB
should be fine.

Change-Id: If09eab7d16ae67bd252020e00e8812ff252f065b

commit_message:
Fix test_external_network_visibility

The previous fix in I0219e17d2ec70939039344826d35cb533b3ce065
was boneheaded. It filtered the shared networks out of the
part of the test that wasn't affected by shared networks.

This corrects the test to ignore shared subnets in the subnet
list call.

Closes-Bug: #1553595
Change-Id: Iff3fba0d7e06fb26883cd9b64c57cadba9726af4

commit_message:
Take2: Only use screen when terminal is tty

Commit Ia661b4b56827bc07e86ab796d71db5f7528dc4ef did not properly
fix the detection of using the 'screen' formatter versus 'text'.
The default for the command line was always set to 'screen'.

Change-Id: I31c8c7e768a01c038f7f46923e97d3ad6bcb8220
Closes-Bug: #1551431

commit_message:
Update tempest plugin after tempest-lib deprecation

This is a combination of the following 2 commits.
(I combined them to pass the gate job.)

------
Update tempest plugin after tempest-lib deprecation

Closes-Bug: #1552598
Related: blueprint tempest-lib-reintegration
------
TrivialFix: Move from tempest to tempest.lib

As [1] has merged, to prevent future tempest gate failures,
we can move tempest to tempest.lib for the Network Client.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/290108/
------

commit_message:
Workaround for argparse update

pip tries to install new version of argparse on top of the already existent one and fails.

As a temporary fix we disable updates of already installed modules in tox configuration.

Related-Bug: #1536188

Change-Id: Ibed2dccacdce53f3d05f8e24a7144fc2bb4d3b9c

subject: Prevent IP conflicts on lxcbr0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 15:27:38.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test.yml'], 'message': 'Prevent IP conflicts on lxcbr0

We assign IPs to the containers from the dhcp range handled by lxc. This
could cause random failures due to IP conflicts on this range.

Adjusting the dhcp range for lxc and adjusting the assigned IPs for
containers to fall outside of that range resolves this.

Change-Id: I88af22c73543e4d96d2dbe5fc440e5d11738d927
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent IP conflicts on lxcbr0

We assign IPs to the containers from the dhcp range handled by lxc. This
could cause random failures due to IP conflicts on this range.

Adjusting the dhcp range for lxc and adjusting the assigned IPs for
containers to fall outside of that range resolves this.

Change-Id: I88af22c73543e4d96d2dbe5fc440e5d11738d927

subject: raise exception on adding same rules with different literal order
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-11 05:21:53.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/datalog/test_compiler.py', 'congress/datalog/compile.py'], 'message': 'raise exception on adding same rules with different literal order

currently, same rules with different literal order
are considered as diff rules if it has datasource tables. The
reason is while eliminating column references, we prepend the prefix
x_i for unnamed arguments, resulting in diff hash, hence diff rules.

This can be fixed either using the same prefix or by the sorting
the literals, which would be identified as same rules

This commit uses the same-prefix solution.

Change-Id: I4873de8be88894b28a4153a3d5bcb0cdefff9f9a
Closes-Bug:#1553430
'}]
commit_message:
raise exception on adding same rules with different literal order

currently, same rules with different literal order
are considered as diff rules if it has datasource tables. The
reason is while eliminating column references, we prepend the prefix
x_i for unnamed arguments, resulting in diff hash, hence diff rules.

This can be fixed either using the same prefix or by the sorting
the literals, which would be identified as same rules

This commit uses the same-prefix solution.

Change-Id: I4873de8be88894b28a4153a3d5bcb0cdefff9f9a
Closes-Bug:#1553430

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-09 17:36:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py'], 'message': 'tests: Add some basic compute_api tests for attaching volumes

It is really interesting that we never tested most of this logic even
though there is quite a bit of stuff going on. We only have some basic
tests in test_compute.py that do not check for different failure
conditions.

This patch adds some basic unit tests for the basic case of attaching a
volume to a non-shelved instance, and a failure to reserve a volume.

Change-Id: I6d3745dc17cd8534bd90c4d76448434bdc26ae83
'}]
commit_message:
tests: Add some basic compute_api tests for attaching volumes

It is really interesting that we never tested most of this logic even
though there is quite a bit of stuff going on. We only have some basic
tests in test_compute.py that do not check for different failure
conditions.

This patch adds some basic unit tests for the basic case of attaching a
volume to a non-shelved instance, and a failure to reserve a volume.

Change-Id: I6d3745dc17cd8534bd90c4d76448434bdc26ae83

commit_message:
mysqld config: set innodb_file_per_table to ON

Innodb uses a single file by default, that may grow up to tens of
gigabytes.
This patch sets innodb_file_per_table option to ON so that db file can
be split.

Change-Id: Ia2a39a404d1cf01eb47e34aab88c3806bfb4844c

In order for instance HA to function safely, nova-compute needs access

commit_message:
Set host in nova.conf for compute nodes

In order for instance HA to function safely, nova-compute needs access
to the name by which nova knows the current compute node.

Since the names of the nova-compute and neutron ml2 agents must be the
same for vif binding to work, it also sets the host value in
neutron.conf.

Change-Id: I7d07c57b7276815c72d08acaa86f673e43eb0498

commit_message:
Support the deployment of Ceph over IPv6

To deploy Ceph on IPv6, we need to enable ms_bind_ipv6 in addition
to passing the list of MON IPs in brackets.

Change-Id: I3644b8fc06458e68574afa5573f07442f0a09190
(cherry picked from commit 99cdabc403e5e9ff66182526ff6c577bdc1f9164)

We are having problems retrieving the entire ansible role job console
logs from swift via our logs.openstack.org wsgi service. While we debug
this problem switch these jobs to copy the console log to the disk based
server.

Change-Id: Ia9e89d79016e3fe782505343174b4e9f4a4e57eb
'}]
commit_message:
Ansible role jobs copy console to disk not swift

We are having problems retrieving the entire ansible role job console
logs from swift via our logs.openstack.org wsgi service. While we debug
this problem switch these jobs to copy the console log to the disk based
server.

Change-Id: Ia9e89d79016e3fe782505343174b4e9f4a4e57eb

subject: Use dd to create swapfile, ensure swap amount == 8GB
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-03-10 22:03:35.000000000', 'files': ['functions.sh'], 'message': "Use dd to create swapfile, ensure swap amount == 8GB

It is not possible to use a swapfile generated by fallocate on a
xfs filesystem which is shipped by default on CentOS >7.
So since [1], we effectively ran jobs on CentOS VMs without any
swap.
Use dd as a way of creating the swapfile that works on both Ubuntu
and CentOS with a slight performance hit and ensure it's mounted
properly so we don't have a silent failure.

Also manage a new specific case, Vexxhost VMs ship with 2GB of swap
which is not in line with the expectation that all VMs should have
8GB. If there is less than 8GB of swap (or zero), we will make up
for the difference.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/278557/

Change-Id: Iaf4de66475d747f62bd49dfe7318131cbeb03be8
"}]
commit_message:
Use dd to create swapfile, ensure swap amount == 8GB

It is not possible to use a swapfile generated by fallocate on a
xfs filesystem which is shipped by default on CentOS >7.
So since [1], we effectively ran jobs on CentOS VMs without any
swap.
Use dd as a way of creating the swapfile that works on both Ubuntu
and CentOS with a slight performance hit and ensure it's mounted
properly so we don't have a silent failure.

Also manage a new specific case, Vexxhost VMs ship with 2GB of swap
which is not in line with the expectation that all VMs should have
8GB. If there is less than 8GB of swap (or zero), we will make up
for the difference.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/278557/

Change-Id: Iaf4de66475d747f62bd49dfe7318131cbeb03be8

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-03-07 13:44:39.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/drbdmanagedrv.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_drbdmanagedrv.py'], 'message': 'DRBD: Policy-based waiting for completion

The more nodes are in a cluster, the higher the chance that one or more
of them are not available. Waiting on all nodes will not work any more,
so give the user a way to define what conditions are acceptable (to the
management, etc.) to continue.

The upcoming DRBDmanage 1.0 release will have a (sample) policy plugin,
so make that available in Cinder, too.
Documentation is at
    http://drbd.linbit.com/users-guide-9.0/s-drbdmanage-deployment-policy.html

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ib2bc888ca5df87a4de97ee07601d0280a04c7a81
'}]
commit_message:
DRBD: Policy-based waiting for completion

The more nodes are in a cluster, the higher the chance that one or more
of them are not available. Waiting on all nodes will not work any more,
so give the user a way to define what conditions are acceptable (to the
management, etc.) to continue.

The upcoming DRBDmanage 1.0 release will have a (sample) policy plugin,
so make that available in Cinder, too.
Documentation is at
    http://drbd.linbit.com/users-guide-9.0/s-drbdmanage-deployment-policy.html

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ib2bc888ca5df87a4de97ee07601d0280a04c7a81

commit_message:
Remove bandit.yaml in favor of defaults

This patch removes the bandit.yaml and just uses the defaults. As
such there are a few flagged issues that needed correcting.

The hits are now marked with "# nosec" so that they'll be ignored
since the hits were not security-related.

Co-Authored-By: Brant Knudson <bknudson@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Eric Brown <browne@vmware.com>

Change-Id: Ib253a4a21156b6606c356ade46c72c6ace01a1af

saved seperately by the devstack-logs publisher.

Add "|| true" rescue commands to the chef-client invocations, so that

Change-Id: I475509d770e90da38ba76d4fe126d6610ef280e2
'}]
commit_message:
Use new devstack-logs publisher

Instead of pasting all the logs onto the console, we can now have them
saved seperately by the devstack-logs publisher.

Add "|| true" rescue commands to the chef-client invocations, so that
rake will continue to run through to the save_logs even if the chef run
fails.

Change-Id: I475509d770e90da38ba76d4fe126d6610ef280e2

commit_message:
Missing dependency for domain config.

When using "domain_config_directory", the /etc/keystone directory is
expected to be present.  This require the package to be present.  This
bit add this missing dependency.

subject: Prevent IP conflicts on lxcbr0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 15:30:04.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test.yml'], 'message': 'Prevent IP conflicts on lxcbr0

We assign IPs to the containers from the dhcp range handled by lxc. This
could cause random failures due to IP conflicts on this range.

Adjusting the dhcp range for lxc and adjusting the assigned IPs for
containers to fall outside of that range resolves this.

Change-Id: I1b2f5c9645959875c5ac500b4799517a3b041d71
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent IP conflicts on lxcbr0

We assign IPs to the containers from the dhcp range handled by lxc. This
could cause random failures due to IP conflicts on this range.

Adjusting the dhcp range for lxc and adjusting the assigned IPs for
containers to fall outside of that range resolves this.

Change-Id: I1b2f5c9645959875c5ac500b4799517a3b041d71

commit_message:
Set TCP keepalive options

The following configuration options are in the sample config
but are not used:

- tcp_keepalive
- tcp_keepidle
- tcp_keepalive_interval
- tcp_keepalive_count

Use the utility function from oslo_utils to set the socket options.

Change-Id: I38f501202184792f12bf153a800e39a4b1a3fccb
Closes-Bug: #1554022

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 01:55:43.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/actions/create-volume.service.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/actions/edit.action.service.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/action-list/actions.service.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/action-list/actions.directive.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/launch-instance-modal.service.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/actions/launch-instance.service.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/actions/create.action.service.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/modal/wizard.controller.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/action-list/actions.controller.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/table/images-table.html', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/table/images.controller.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/actions/update-metadata.action.service.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/actions/delete-image.service.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/modal/delete-modal.service.js'], 'message': "WIP Images Actions Return Promises

REVIEWERS NOTE: Some work still in progress to remove events that are
no longer needed by the actions.

The Angular images actions now consistently return a promise. This allows
a view to fetch an image related action from the registry, call it, and
have a consistent way to know that it is complete.

Promises are preferred over events because they require less setup
and teardown, better handle the asynchronous nature of modal actions
and don't require a parent-child scope relationship.

Future patches may add data to the promise so that the view can know
which items were affected by the action, but for now a simple reload
of the items displayed is fast and good enough.

Change-Id: Ib065ad622d1fa9c324a523baebb9b304aecc8945
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-images-table
"}]
commit_message:
WIP Images Actions Return Promises

REVIEWERS NOTE: Some work still in progress to remove events that are
no longer needed by the actions.

The Angular images actions now consistently return a promise. This allows
a view to fetch an image related action from the registry, call it, and
have a consistent way to know that it is complete.

Promises are preferred over events because they require less setup
and teardown, better handle the asynchronous nature of modal actions
and don't require a parent-child scope relationship.

Future patches may add data to the promise so that the view can know
which items were affected by the action, but for now a simple reload
of the items displayed is fast and good enough.

Change-Id: Ib065ad622d1fa9c324a523baebb9b304aecc8945
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-images-table

We need the gcc and other dependencies

Installation of git was never checked in QSG.

Added steps to install git.

Moved the steps related to git clone and other

commit_message:
Restructuring the Quickstart guide

We need the gcc and other dependencies
installed before we can do any tox related
commands.

Installation of git was never checked in QSG.
I happened to create a baremetal CentOS server
with minimal install and there was no git.
Added steps to install git.

Moved the steps related to git clone and other
kolla configuration after basic installation.
since tox fails for gcc.

In the quickstart guide we are generating
the configuration using tox but tox is not
installed before doing so. Adding steps to
install tox before generating conf.

Change-Id: Ic8a756e66d33963e47607ed60c4c768e0859152d

This change generates /etc/sysconf/network-scripts/ifcfg-* for ivs.
It also generates /etc/sysconf/ivs configuration file for ivs.
It supports only RedHat at this point.

Indigo Virtual Switch (IVS, https://github.com/floodlight/ivs)
is a virtual switch for Linux. It is compatible with the KVM
hypervisor and leveraging the Open vSwitch kernel module for
packet forwarding. There are three major differences between
IVS and OVS:
1. Each node can have at most one ivs, name is not required.
2. Bond is not allowed to attach to an ivs. It is the SDN
controller's job to dynamically form bonds on ivs.
3. IP address can only be statically assigned.

commit_message:
Enable os_net_config to configure IVS

This change generates /etc/sysconf/network-scripts/ifcfg-* for ivs.
It also generates /etc/sysconf/ivs configuration file for ivs.
It supports only RedHat at this point.

Indigo Virtual Switch (IVS, https://github.com/floodlight/ivs)
is a virtual switch for Linux. It is compatible with the KVM
hypervisor and leveraging the Open vSwitch kernel module for
packet forwarding. There are three major differences between
IVS and OVS:
1. Each node can have at most one ivs, name is not required.
2. Bond is not allowed to attach to an ivs. It is the SDN
controller's job to dynamically form bonds on ivs.
3. IP address can only be statically assigned.

Change-Id: I276d736794d123405de793c2a4eb2c1ee55a0fad

This patch set updates all compute objects to use consistent
resource.prop for timestamps and booleans. In particular, the
following changes were made:
  - Clarify documentation for timestamp and boolean attributes
  - Use 'is_' prefix and boolean type for boolean attributes
  - Use '_at' suffix and timestamp type for timestamp attributes

Change-Id: I6dbb946dad0d9daee5fd766fab6577e9701edb35
Partial-Bug: #1544584
"}]
commit_message:
Consistent resource.prop for timestamps and booleans (compute)

This patch set updates all compute objects to use consistent
resource.prop for timestamps and booleans. In particular, the
following changes were made:
  - Clarify documentation for timestamp and boolean attributes
  - Use 'is_' prefix and boolean type for boolean attributes
  - Use '_at' suffix and timestamp type for timestamp attributes

Change-Id: I6dbb946dad0d9daee5fd766fab6577e9701edb35
Partial-Bug: #1544584

During evacuation a local connector is built. This is the
wrong connector to use for cinder terminate_connection.
In order to fix this, store the initial connector with
the BDM connection_info. Use the stored connector when
we detect that we have this wrong host situation.

This fix does not work for existing attachments
(made prior to this patch) because existing attachments
don't have the connector stashed in the bdm.connection_info.
In cases where the original connector was not saved, leave

Change-Id: I793f2996fc0af1c321a240ad9348dc9bce816030
Partial-Bug: #1522496
"}]
commit_message:
Provide correct connector for evacuate terminate

During evacuation a local connector is built. This is the
wrong connector to use for cinder terminate_connection.
In order to fix this, store the initial connector with
the BDM connection_info. Use the stored connector when
we detect that we have this wrong host situation.

This fix does not work for existing attachments
(made prior to this patch) because existing attachments
don't have the connector stashed in the bdm.connection_info.
In cases where the original connector was not saved, leave
the behavior as-is.

Change-Id: I793f2996fc0af1c321a240ad9348dc9bce816030
Partial-Bug: #1522496

commit_message:
Should not raise Exception before connection close

Currently VmdkReadHandle.close() raises a VimException before
the read connection is closed, this patch let's add a `finally`
to close it.

Change-Id: Ib5b388f7eeb9f26de66c308a89f70c85ba6dc7a9

commit_message:
Decouple ceilometerclient without aodh services running

Currently, the ceilometerclient will be broken if aodh services not
running, it will be worse if users don't want alarming service and they
must start the aodh services.

Change-Id: Idf7468f28cee001262b67b6e110357ffc971535a
Closes-Bug: #1550095

commit_message:
Enhances client to support unique meter retrieval

meter list API is enhanced to support a unique param
If specified as True, it returns a unique list of
meters.

This patch enhances the ceilometer-client to support
the unique argument in the shell and the client bindings.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1506959

Change-Id: I011ca725c25e1cdbe9891c3719f13f5cd34142ea

commit_message:
Adding method "__setitem__"  for class "ImageTarget"

Fix 500 error when got again image data with caching.
It happens for the reason cache middleware couldn't assign
value to image_meta['size'] because it expects a dictionary
(as it was in v1 api), but in v2 api it's ImageTarget object.

Change-Id: I2281a0174a032aa00d9fb51ebdb88c5ac228d163
Closes-bug: #1533270
Closes-bug: #1533150

subject: Mock swiftclient's functions in tests
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-11 12:10:50.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/tests/unit/test_swift_store.py'], 'message': "Mock swiftclient's functions in tests

swiftclient changed their code so if the chuck size is greater than
zero it will return a generator otherwise it will return the response.
Which would be the object you are looking for.  This causes our tests
to fail since they are always expecting the response instead of a
generator.

Closes-bug: 1556059

Co-Authored-by: avarner <avarner@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I62cc037493af87373a75e37e2d9f33b8aedf9889
"}]
commit_message:
Mock swiftclient's functions in tests

swiftclient changed their code so if the chuck size is greater than
zero it will return a generator otherwise it will return the response.
Which would be the object you are looking for.  This causes our tests
to fail since they are always expecting the response instead of a
generator.

Closes-bug: 1556059

Co-Authored-by: avarner <avarner@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I62cc037493af87373a75e37e2d9f33b8aedf9889

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-12-10 08:40:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/common/config.py', 'neutron/notifiers/nova.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/notifiers/test_nova.py'], 'message': 'Add option for nova endpoint type

When the neutron notification to nova was updated to use novaclient the
nova_url parameter was disabled.  This prevents administrators from
using anything but the publicURL as the proper endpoint to notify nova.
This patch adds an option to pass on to novaclient for the
endpoint_type so that the administrator can set the notification url to
public, internal or admin.

Change-Id: I405f761944449cab6b8c8895f98419f79cd74cad
Closes-Bug: #1478471
DocImpact: Need to add a new option to the neutron configuration
reference.
'}]
commit_message:
Add option for nova endpoint type

When the neutron notification to nova was updated to use novaclient the
nova_url parameter was disabled.  This prevents administrators from
using anything but the publicURL as the proper endpoint to notify nova.
This patch adds an option to pass on to novaclient for the
endpoint_type so that the administrator can set the notification url to
public, internal or admin.

Change-Id: I405f761944449cab6b8c8895f98419f79cd74cad
Closes-Bug: #1478471
DocImpact: Need to add a new option to the neutron configuration
reference.

commit_message:
Forcibly clear parameters now passed as parameter_defaults

The previous version of the client used to pass the Heat template
parameters in the 'parameters:' section while the newer versions
use 'parameter_defaults:' but those won't override what was
passed previously because on update we use 'existing: true'.

Closes-Bug: 1554564
Change-Id: Iabc94ad1cce6f1744429aca9f866a59a698f5680
Depends-On: I662e4b0e3cf909ec2583d087ca1d246715caf0f7
Co-Authored-By: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

commit_message:
DeploymentGraph merged tasks and own tasks getters are separated

There was no method to get own Cluster deployment graph. (Used for
cluster-level customization)

So the get_deployment_tasks method of Cluster objects was
separated into get_deployment_tasks what returning merged graph and
get_own_deployment_tasks that returning only cluster-level deployment tasks.

Change-Id: Iced0a9c00b8f9204e2ae90e3cb1772365698cd85
Implements: blueprint custom-graph-execution

commit_message:
Remove unused enable_v3_api config option

The option was used to enable experimental Artifacts API
that was moved to glance-glare service. This config option
does not do anything and is removed to avoid confusion.

Removed apropriate sections from example config files as well.

Change-Id: Ie84f3f65ec88fd30197758ac319ef5b2f4c313e2
Closes-bug: 1556050

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-03-04 08:35:38.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/models/environment.py'], 'message': "Fix inst.repo / inst.ks kernel parameters for Anaconda for USB boot

Adjusted as hd:LABEL:/ source are not suitable for installation from
usb drive because Anaconda searching for ISO file with repo.
Installation will fail if iso file can't be found. So we
change `repo` to cdrom:OpenStack_Fuel:/ and `ks` to
cdrom:OpenStack_Fuel:/ks.cfg both for cdrom and usb installation.

Related-Bug: #1540862
"}]
commit_message:
Fix inst.repo / inst.ks kernel parameters for Anaconda for USB boot

Adjusted as hd:LABEL:/ source are not suitable for installation from
usb drive because Anaconda searching for ISO file with repo.
Installation will fail if iso file can't be found. So we
change `repo` to cdrom:OpenStack_Fuel:/ and `ks` to
cdrom:OpenStack_Fuel:/ks.cfg both for cdrom and usb installation.

Also `repo` and `ks` kernel parameters changed to `inst.repo` and `inst.ks`

Change-Id: Icaf51417daa2426aa3714daa7a38d3c18b989de6
Related-Bug: #1540862

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-10 15:25:28.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/test_client_cmode.py', 'manila/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/client_cmode.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/fakes.py'], 'message': "NetApp cDOT APIs may get too little data

There are a few API calls in the NetApp cDOT driver where
the default value of 20 records in iterator queries isn't
overridden and is potentially too low in some deployments.
This commit resolves the issue by adding a generic getter
API pagination wrapper and using that for all appropriate
API calls.

Change-Id: Ia05ac6be2f84bb0db3adf458fb399187be0b2635
Closes-Bug: #1500255
"}]
commit_message:
NetApp cDOT APIs may get too little data

There are a few API calls in the NetApp cDOT driver where
the default value of 20 records in iterator queries isn't
overridden and is potentially too low in some deployments.
This commit resolves the issue by adding a generic getter
API pagination wrapper and using that for all appropriate
API calls.

Change-Id: Ia05ac6be2f84bb0db3adf458fb399187be0b2635
Closes-Bug: #1500255

commit_message:
Get rid of fake tasks for test_deletion_during_deployment

Concurrent fake threads for tasks in test_deletion_during_deployment
cause deadlocks in the database.
Affected tests are rewritten to send notifications directly
using NailgunReceiver call.

Change-Id: I1484be9ce560d321b8a9e021dfc7f9bec696eef0
Closes-Bug: #1554319
Related-Bug: #1541005

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-10 16:50:06.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_translation_rule.py', 'heat_integrationtests/functional/test_preview.py', 'heat/engine/translation.py'], 'message': "Fix stack preview

Don't execute translation rule for property that contains
a GetParam function that can't be resolved at the moment.
Such situation happens when we try to resolve get_param function
that refer to parameter with None value. We receive parameter value
from parent stack, where this value is a reference to some resource
without resource_id, so this situation is legal for stack preview
and we shouldn't fail. Note, that we can reproduce this behaviour
only with resources with hidden parameters and overrided  get_resource_id
method, that returns None if resoruce creation has not been started yet.

Change-Id: Ia1097940db983721c8b5116db7ee0a2c4c45339d
Closes-Bug: #1548802
"}]
commit_message:
Fix stack preview

Don't execute translation rule for property that contains
a GetParam function that can't be resolved at the moment.
Such situation happens when we try to resolve get_param function
that refer to parameter with None value. We receive parameter value
from parent stack, where this value is a reference to some resource
without resource_id, so this situation is legal for stack preview
and we shouldn't fail. Note, that we can reproduce this behaviour
only with resources with hidden parameters and overrided  get_resource_id
method, that returns None if resoruce creation has not been started yet.

Change-Id: Ia1097940db983721c8b5116db7ee0a2c4c45339d
Closes-Bug: #1548802

commit_message:
Prevent any property change from replacing OS::Nova::Server

This change ensures that any property change in an OS::Nova::Server
resource will not result in the server being replaced. This is a more
complete approach to only protecting servers from changes to the
user_data property - upgrades testing have also shown replacement issues
with other properties such as scheduler_hints.

Change-Id: I6127ca9c3abb57c025df7d039c03bb7e64efad2c
Related-Bug: #1539541

commit_message:
Pass public_addr to ceph::profile::params instead of ceph::mon

The ceph::mon resource is a define not a class so the hieradata is
not applied transparently; this change passes it to
ceph::profile::params instead which is a class.

Change-Id: Ia6518b769feb147f862b67915432d1bb7b47a415
Depends-On: I56f969328c68ed83a9b2d54ff4254dbcd6f55de0

subject: Fix tests to work under both pymsysql 0.6.2 and 0.7.x
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-11 01:10:22.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/tests/old_import_api/sqlalchemy/test_exc_filters.py', 'oslo_db/tests/sqlalchemy/test_exc_filters.py'], 'message': "Fix tests to work under both pymsysql 0.6.2 and 0.7.x

In 0.6.2, the exc.statement and exc.params were as follows:
exc.statement = {unicode} u'INSERT INTO resource_entity (id, foo_id)
                VALUES (%s, %s)'
exc.params = {tuple} (1, 2)

In 0.7.1, the exc.statement and exc.params are as follows:
exc.statement = {unicode} u'INSERT INTO resource_entity (id, foo_id)
                VALUES (%(id)s, %(foo_id)s)'
exc.params = {dict} {'id': 1, 'foo_id': 2}

So the easiest thing to support both is to use string interpolation
and then check if they are equal. This approach works for both py34
and py27 as well. Note that we still have to test the old way for
sqlite which has (?, ?) in the SQL statement.

NOTE(tonyb): We need to make the same change in
.../old_import_api/.../test_exc_filters.py in the stable/kilo branch.
This was removed in the liberty timeframe in
If3036e03a68c2e865b5f0495c74fe8303de93d21

Closes-Bug: #1533861
Change-Id: Iab9f0e4b4dd337363dd7e705c1155f3f6517b404
(cherry picked from commit 543d577613a5ccc12f4482d9e2f9ce1f29db21b4)
(cherry picked from commit 40004ebbca6c345da09cec4e91f85fc73ab18e70)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix tests to work under both pymsysql 0.6.2 and 0.7.x

In 0.6.2, the exc.statement and exc.params were as follows:
exc.statement = {unicode} u'INSERT INTO resource_entity (id, foo_id)
                VALUES (%s, %s)'
exc.params = {tuple} (1, 2)

In 0.7.1, the exc.statement and exc.params are as follows:
exc.statement = {unicode} u'INSERT INTO resource_entity (id, foo_id)
                VALUES (%(id)s, %(foo_id)s)'
exc.params = {dict} {'id': 1, 'foo_id': 2}

So the easiest thing to support both is to use string interpolation
and then check if they are equal. This approach works for both py34
and py27 as well. Note that we still have to test the old way for
sqlite which has (?, ?) in the SQL statement.

NOTE(tonyb): We need to make the same change in
.../old_import_api/.../test_exc_filters.py in the stable/kilo branch.
This was removed in the liberty timeframe in
If3036e03a68c2e865b5f0495c74fe8303de93d21

commit_message:
Forcibly clear parameters now passed as parameter_defaults

The previous version of the client used to pass the Heat template
parameters in the 'parameters:' section while the newer versions
use 'parameter_defaults:' but those won't override what was
passed previously because on update we use 'existing: true'.

Conflicts:
	tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py
	tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py

Closes-Bug: 1554564
Change-Id: Iabc94ad1cce6f1744429aca9f866a59a698f5680
Depends-On: I662e4b0e3cf909ec2583d087ca1d246715caf0f7

(cherry picked from commit f4ce6893e3a6a5849ca3312ed06569d217704375)

subject: IPv6: pass bracketed IP to rabbitmq puppet module
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-11 13:42:38.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/controller.yaml'], 'message': "IPv6: pass bracketed IP to rabbitmq puppet module

Without this, rabbitmq initialization can fail because it doesn't use
the URI format of the IP address:

Error: curl -k --noproxy localhost --retry 30 --retry-delay 6 -f -L -o
/var/lib/rabbitmq/rabbitmqadmin
http://guest:guest@fd00:fd00:fd00:2000::12:15672/cli/rabbitmqadmin
returned 7 instead of one of [0]

Change-Id: Iaa7e2f503a101462d481f5263b398290377467f3
"}]
commit_message:
IPv6: pass bracketed IP to rabbitmq puppet module

Without this, rabbitmq initialization can fail because it doesn't use
the URI format of the IP address:

Error: curl -k --noproxy localhost --retry 30 --retry-delay 6 -f -L -o
/var/lib/rabbitmq/rabbitmqadmin
http://guest:guest@fd00:fd00:fd00:2000::12:15672/cli/rabbitmqadmin
returned 7 instead of one of [0]

Change-Id: Iaa7e2f503a101462d481f5263b398290377467f3

subject: Meta values evaluation was fixed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-10 12:53:53.000000000', 'files': ['murano/dsl/murano_property.py', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/meta/TestMeta.yaml', 'murano/dsl/executor.py', 'murano/dsl/murano_method.py', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/test_meta.py', 'murano/dsl/murano_type.py', 'murano/dsl/helpers.py', 'murano/dsl/murano_package.py'], 'message': 'Meta values evaluation was fixed

Meta property values were not evaluated.
As a result property value 4 considered to be an integer
but 2+2 to be a string "2+2". This commit fixes 2 things:

1) Adds evaluation to property values making embedded
    YAQL expressions to be evaluated
2) Changes the contexts on which Meta is calculated. Before
    This fix everything was done in caller context thus value
    of the local variables of functions where Meta was accessed
    could be used in Meta definitions

Change-Id: I50de9199e5efa36a668fd3640a016a723326cae7
Closes-Bug: #1555617
'}]
commit_message:
Meta values evaluation was fixed

Meta property values were not evaluated.
As a result property value 4 considered to be an integer
but 2+2 to be a string "2+2". This commit fixes 2 things:

1) Adds evaluation to property values making embedded
    YAQL expressions to be evaluated
2) Changes the contexts on which Meta is calculated. Before
    This fix everything was done in caller context thus value
    of the local variables of functions where Meta was accessed
    could be used in Meta definitions

Change-Id: I50de9199e5efa36a668fd3640a016a723326cae7
Closes-Bug: #1555617

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-06 18:10:38.000000000', 'files': ['os_cloud_config/nodes.py', 'os_cloud_config/exception.py', 'os_cloud_config/tests/test_nodes.py'], 'message': "Rewrite node creating and updating code

This change started as an attempt to stop hardcoding ironic properties,
but turns out a lot of things need fixing. Highlights:
* Stop hardcoding flavor (e.g. agent, pxe) for each driver
* Support only generic properties with pm_* names. Driver-specific things
  should stay with their prefix. Existing pm_* driver-specific things
  were deprecated.
* Pass through everything that starts with driver-specific prefix to
  node's driver_info.
* Dropped handling Conflict exceptions - ironicclient is doing it for
  some time already (and does better job in it).
* Issue a specific exception for malformed instackenv.json.
* Optimize calls to ironic (use list with details instead of list+get)
* Use 'add' operation instead of 'replace', as it allows both adding
  and overwriting (despite its name).
* Fixed some small issues like adding a dict to a set.

Change-Id: Id3fb1a20e9790ce7e45f1fac97ddea4f8edc8ac3
"}]
commit_message:
Rewrite node creating and updating code

This change started as an attempt to stop hardcoding ironic properties,
but turns out a lot of things need fixing. Highlights:
* Stop hardcoding flavor (e.g. agent, pxe) for each driver
* Support only generic properties with pm_* names. Driver-specific things
  should stay with their prefix. Existing pm_* driver-specific things
  were deprecated.
* Pass through everything that starts with driver-specific prefix to
  node's driver_info.
* Dropped handling Conflict exceptions - ironicclient is doing it for
  some time already (and does better job in it).
* Issue a specific exception for malformed instackenv.json.
* Optimize calls to ironic (use list with details instead of list+get)
* Use 'add' operation instead of 'replace', as it allows both adding
  and overwriting (despite its name).
* Fixed some small issues like adding a dict to a set.

Change-Id: Id3fb1a20e9790ce7e45f1fac97ddea4f8edc8ac3

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-08 15:34:21.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/manager.py', 'manila/tests/share/test_manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix status update for replicas

When an error is raised by a driver during
the update_replica_state loop in the
manager, it will break out of the loop
and not update the other replicas. This change
has the manager set that replica's "replica_state"
and "status" to ERROR instead of raising an exception,
then continue checking the other replicas.

Closes-Bug: 1554270
Change-Id: I6df8d0a4c5f3a7304d51ae97f710f4faf61a5adb
'}]
commit_message:
Fix status update for replicas

When an error is raised by a driver during
the update_replica_state loop in the
manager, it will break out of the loop
and not update the other replicas. This change
has the manager set that replica's "replica_state"
and "status" to ERROR instead of raising an exception,
then continue checking the other replicas.

Closes-Bug: 1554270
Change-Id: I6df8d0a4c5f3a7304d51ae97f710f4faf61a5adb

commit_message:
Enable notifications on undercloud

Configure notifications for Keystone, Glance, Nova, Heat, and Neutron.

This allows users to listen on the notification bus for things like
resource tracking and monitoring.

subject: Revert "Ensure the json result type is bytes on Python 3"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 09:00:08.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_impl_rabbit.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_kafka.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/protocols/amqp/driver.py', 'oslo_messaging/tests/test_exception_serialization.py', 'oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_impl_kafka.py', 'oslo_messaging/notify/_impl_log.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/common.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Ensure the json result type is bytes on Python 3"

This reverts commit bd81d09c02c5bc8561ad04de91802a5c1917d9e9.

I understand that the change was supposed to fix something, but instead it broke all tests on Python 3!?

It's wrong to replace blindly json.dumps() with jsonutils.dump_as_bytes(). In oslo messaging, the result is usually used as a value in a dictionary, and then the whole dictionary is passed to a second serializer which also serialize to JSON.

Sorry, I don't understand everything, but at least I see that tests passed on py3 before the change, and started to fail with the change.

Maybe json(utils).dumps() is misused in some places, but in this case, you should write a change which only fix these specific places, not replace all calls to dumps().

Change-Id: Icd54ee8e3f5c976dfd50b4b62c7f51288649e112
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Ensure the json result type is bytes on Python 3"

This reverts commit bd81d09c02c5bc8561ad04de91802a5c1917d9e9.

I understand that the change was supposed to fix something, but instead it broke all tests on Python 3!?

It's wrong to replace blindly json.dumps() with jsonutils.dump_as_bytes(). In oslo messaging, the result is usually used as a value in a dictionary, and then the whole dictionary is passed to a second serializer which also serialize to JSON.

Sorry, I don't understand everything, but at least I see that tests passed on py3 before the change, and started to fail with the change.

Maybe json(utils).dumps() is misused in some places, but in this case, you should write a change which only fix these specific places, not replace all calls to dumps().

Change-Id: Icd54ee8e3f5c976dfd50b4b62c7f51288649e112

subject: Increase partitioning logic period
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 13:08:21.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/storage/__init__.py'], 'message': "Increase partitioning logic period

gnocchi uses the reporting worker to partition tasks across each of
the processing workers. by default reporter runs every 10s and
processor worker every 5s. unfortunately, in any environment, small
or large, the processor takes much longer than 10s to process it's
data. because of that, the repartition messages that the reporter
sends up queues up so the processor ends up running through a list
of stale repartition messages before it can grab a new set of
metrics.

This calls for an increase in the period of which the reporter runs.

Change-Id: Ie7b114a1c8f55e7291057e8193172c4f188a2f61
Closes-Bug: #1554738
(cherry picked from commit d87048d34693bc3ee45b8fa152f133070f9c3f7f)
"}]
commit_message:
Increase partitioning logic period

gnocchi uses the reporting worker to partition tasks across each of
the processing workers. by default reporter runs every 10s and
processor worker every 5s. unfortunately, in any environment, small
or large, the processor takes much longer than 10s to process it's
data. because of that, the repartition messages that the reporter
sends up queues up so the processor ends up running through a list
of stale repartition messages before it can grab a new set of
metrics.

This calls for an increase in the period of which the reporter runs.

Change-Id: Ie7b114a1c8f55e7291057e8193172c4f188a2f61
Closes-Bug: #1554738
(cherry picked from commit d87048d34693bc3ee45b8fa152f133070f9c3f7f)

When downloading a streamed chunk from swift through glance gives tar
invalid input, tar will exit, but leave the plugin still trying to write
data to the dead process.

To stop this we can spot when the tar process exits early, and be sure

Closes-Bug: 1552293
'}]
commit_message:
xenapi: fix when tar exits early during download

When downloading a streamed chunk from swift through glance gives tar
invalid input, tar will exit, but leave the plugin still trying to write
data to the dead process.

To stop this we can spot when the tar process exits early, and be sure
to stop trying to write more data to the dead process.

Change-Id: Ic2bc89fa6d08db505b044a9498c1bfa5b884a056
Closes-Bug: 1552293

commit_message:
Install rake lint when no Gemfile is found

With the move to ubuntu-trusty, puppet projects without
a Gemfile started to fail due to rake not being installed.

Install rake on this case, as well as needed dependencies
to run contents inside Rakefile.

 - CobblerProvider: json doesn't support comments
 - OpenStackProvider: Remove "\n" from json since docutils transforms it

Change-Id: Ia3762dc00e093b1bc0669f55032f5224db625bcd

commit_message:
[docs] Add code block types into docstrings

Most our docstrings are used for auto-generation docs, so it would be
nice to mark code blocks with correct identifiers.

Also, this patch fixes next issues:
 - CobblerProvider: json doesn't support comments
 - OpenStackProvider: Remove "\n" from json since docutils transforms it
   to new line.
Change-Id: Ia3762dc00e093b1bc0669f55032f5224db625bcd

subject: Fix unstable DB migration tests
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2417, 'name': 'Ben Swartzlander', 'email': 'ben@swartzlander.org', 'username': 'bswartz'}, {'_account_id': 6491, 'name': 'xing-yang', 'email': 'xingyang105@gmail.com', 'username': 'xing-yang'}, {'_account_id': 7102, 'name': 'Thomas Bechtold', 'email': 'thomas.bechtold@canonical.com', 'username': 'toabctl'}, {'_account_id': 11047, 'name': 'Mark Sturdevant', 'email': 'mark.sturdevant@ibm.com', 'username': 'markstur'}, {'_account_id': 11865, 'name': 'Clinton Knight', 'email': 'cknight@netapp.com', 'username': 'cknight'}, {'_account_id': 14567, 'name': 'Rodrigo Barbieri', 'email': 'rodrigo.barbieri@canonical.com', 'username': 'ganso'}, {'_account_id': 16643, 'name': 'Goutham Pacha Ravi', 'email': 'gouthampravi@gmail.com', 'username': 'gouthamr'}, {'_account_id': 17097, 'name': 'Tiago Pasqualini da Silva', 'email': 'tiago.pasqualini@canonical.com', 'username': 'tiago.pasqualini'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-10 20:03:47.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/utils.py', 'manila/tests/db/migrations/alembic/test_migration.py'], 'message': "Fix unstable DB migration tests

Unit test 'test_walk_versions' in
'manila.tests.db.migrations.alembic.test_migration' module
takes abnormally very long time sometimes.
In common cases it takes about 5-10 seconds in CI for Mitaka set of
DB migrations.
In CI runs when this test fails, 'postgres' variant takes
about 47 seconds and mysql reaches common test timeout of 60 seconds.

Note, that this test becomes slower with each
addition of new DB migration. Also, 'pymysql' works much slower
on slow nodes than 'psycopg2'.

So, add new test decorator that sets individual test timeout.
And make it be 5 minutes for mentioned test. In worst case of Mitaka
DB migrations set it can take about 2 minutes, but make it bigger
to have a margin for future releases.

Change-Id: I233f96f29fe62231c2e7013b74c06396dd923f27
Closes-Bug: #1501272
"}]
commit_message:
Fix unstable DB migration tests

Unit test 'test_walk_versions' in
'manila.tests.db.migrations.alembic.test_migration' module
takes abnormally very long time sometimes.
In common cases it takes about 5-10 seconds in CI for Mitaka set of
DB migrations.
In CI runs when this test fails, 'postgres' variant takes
about 47 seconds and mysql reaches common test timeout of 60 seconds.

Note, that this test becomes slower with each
addition of new DB migration. Also, 'pymysql' works much slower
on slow nodes than 'psycopg2'.

So, add new test decorator that sets individual test timeout.
And make it be 5 minutes for mentioned test. In worst case of Mitaka
DB migrations set it can take about 2 minutes, but make it bigger
to have a margin for future releases.

Change-Id: I233f96f29fe62231c2e7013b74c06396dd923f27
Closes-Bug: #1501272

revisions:

Atomic's root partition & logical volume defaults to 3G.

logical volume and scale down the docker_pool logical volume.

commit_message:
Allow the containerized compute node to spawn larger VMs

Atomic's root partition & logical volume defaults to 3G.
In order to launch larger VMs, we need to enlarge the root
logical volume and scale down the docker_pool logical volume.
We are allocating 80% of the disk space for vm data and the
remaining 20% for docker images.

Change-Id: If3fff78f476de23c7c51741a49bae227f2cdfe3e
Co-authored-by: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use service tenant for ceilometer

Configure ceilometer to use the service tenant instead of the admin
tenant.  Using the admin tenant is not required and a security risk.

This brings the ceilometer configuration in line with the
recommendations from the official installation guide:
http://docs.openstack.org/kilo/install-guide/install/yum/content/ceilometer-controller-install.html

Change-Id: Ia14695eb23a1ff551fd27f74b4cb864e80b100e3
Partial-Bug: #1358237
(cherry picked from commit 0d47b4d27f2f114fae6d88fd9efaf9fb28f6e052)

commit_message:
Pass identity/auth uris to "openstack::ceilometer"

Key moments:
  * don't modify config manually
  * ceilometer::agent::auth write this options to config
  * override keystone_auth_uri/keystone_identity_uri defaults
    in "openstack::ceilometer"

Change-Id: I6f8d88a0416c2610db290a60b98e62e51911842a
Closes-bug: #1551332

revisions:

Yum update on cinder nodes should be quiet, as it is on controllers,
because results of these updates are sent to Heat. I mistakenly left
this out in the first patch because i used one of the standalone node
upgrade scripts as a copy/paste base for the cinder node upgrade script.

Change-Id: Id13190dc4d242317829c7994088183f52d21461d
'}]
commit_message:
Upgrades: quiet yum upgrade on cinder nodes

Yum update on cinder nodes should be quiet, as it is on controllers,
because results of these updates are sent to Heat. I mistakenly left
this out in the first patch because i used one of the standalone node
upgrade scripts as a copy/paste base for the cinder node upgrade script.

Change-Id: Id13190dc4d242317829c7994088183f52d21461d

subject: disable swift retry
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-11 12:20:41.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/storage/swift.py'], 'message': "disable swift retry

swift has native retry functionality built in and it's enabled by
default. this means every action we do, even those expected to failed,
will repeat 5 times with an additional backoff mechanism. so every
time we have a new metric, there is quite a large delay between first
attempt and confirmation that it does not exist

Change-Id: I4320fb3e8bb30603bd70f8159fbcf855fc4a2880
(cherry picked from commit b66e1fadf2a510541f3e337ce8417112a81077ed)
"}]
commit_message:
disable swift retry

swift has native retry functionality built in and it's enabled by
default. this means every action we do, even those expected to failed,
will repeat 5 times with an additional backoff mechanism. so every
time we have a new metric, there is quite a large delay between first
attempt and confirmation that it does not exist

Change-Id: I4320fb3e8bb30603bd70f8159fbcf855fc4a2880
(cherry picked from commit b66e1fadf2a510541f3e337ce8417112a81077ed)

commit_message:
Fix arg for "Port already exists" error

Ironic port list with provided mac address returns list with one
element, in case port exist. So always get uuid from 0 port.

Closes-Bug: #1555498
Change-Id: I9729e1a0fb158b80ba9b7260e43814bd9ad206d8

commit_message:
cpu_allocation_ratio / ram_allocation_ratio options

The cpu_allocation_ratio option allows specifying what the ratio of virtual
CPUs to physical CPUs should be on a compute node.

The ram_allocation_ratio option allows specifying what the ratio of virtual ram
to to physical ram should be on a compute node.

Change-Id: I13e0015589c4435cf34ec57c0bfad38cddc41e44

commit_message:
Revert "cpu_allocation_ratio / ram_allocation_ratio options"

This causes the tripleo undercloud install to fail and presumably
other deployments where nova::scheduler::filter and
nova::compute are being used together.

This reverts commit e4c3b0ff1c96430efea3815135e07bbb8323d881.
Closes-Bug: #1556041

Change-Id: I5e9e21ff4b49618843cc3d4376c5f323aafd79cf

commit_message:
Remove soft_deleted filter in image cache manage

soft_deleted should not be considered because nova
can't remove the backend image file if the instance
is soft_deleted, otherwise it can lead to problem
when restore operation is triggered.

Change-Id: I5225bba278f02e8aba2f646db22ec00f54479eb0
Partial-Bug: 1484847

subject: Increase partitioning logic period
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 14:42:38.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/storage/__init__.py'], 'message': "Increase partitioning logic period

gnocchi uses the reporting worker to partition tasks across each of
the processing workers. by default reporter runs every 10s and
processor worker every 5s. unfortunately, in any environment, small
or large, the processor takes much longer than 10s to process it's
data. because of that, the repartition messages that the reporter
sends up queues up so the processor ends up running through a list
of stale repartition messages before it can grab a new set of
metrics.

This calls for an increase in the period of which the reporter runs.

Change-Id: Ie7b114a1c8f55e7291057e8193172c4f188a2f61
Closes-Bug: #1554738
"}]
commit_message:
Increase partitioning logic period

gnocchi uses the reporting worker to partition tasks across each of
the processing workers. by default reporter runs every 10s and
processor worker every 5s. unfortunately, in any environment, small
or large, the processor takes much longer than 10s to process it's
data. because of that, the repartition messages that the reporter
sends up queues up so the processor ends up running through a list
of stale repartition messages before it can grab a new set of
metrics.

This calls for an increase in the period of which the reporter runs.

Change-Id: Ie7b114a1c8f55e7291057e8193172c4f188a2f61
Closes-Bug: #1554738

commit_message:
Improve murano modals js hooks

Use new addModalInitFunction horizon js function instead of pushing the
function to private array inside horizon.modals
Calls init functions in case element is found on the page and it's not
modal.

Fixes ':' placement in related form

Related-Bug: #1550822

Change-Id: I65c281dbe52ac6e9dc22722baca32a955397d771

commit_message:
DHCP: Downgrade 'network has been deleted' logs

These will happen all of the time as networks are quickly
created/updated and then deleted. It's not any kind of
actionable warning condition so this patch downgrades them
to debug.

Change-Id: Idcfb185b9a0540c13101dceb3681132f38f1716c
Closes-Bug: #1555842

commit_message:
Clean Upstream CentOS repos which comes with centos-release pkg

We need to clean RPM chroot each time on installing packages from
$(SANDBOX_PACKAGES), since some of them can "bring" centos-release
as dependency

Related-bug: #1541871

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-21 13:41:32.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/extraroute_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_extraroute.py', 'releasenotes/notes/allow-non-admins-to-define-external-extra-routes-0d541fc356a5c546.yaml'], 'message': 'Allow non-admins to define "external" extra-routes

Currently non-admin users can create extra-routes when the nexthop is on
router-interfaces subnets but not on external-network subnet. Indeed
user permissions are used to get router ports in order to validate
nexthops BUT non-admin users don't "see" router port on its external
network.

This change uses an elevated context instead of user context to enable
non-admins to create "external" extra-routes.

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: #1538767
Change-Id: I08b1d8586a4cd241a3589e8cb7151b77ab679124
'}]
commit_message:
Allow non-admins to define "external" extra-routes

Currently non-admin users can create extra-routes when the nexthop is on
router-interfaces subnets but not on external-network subnet. Indeed
user permissions are used to get router ports in order to validate
nexthops BUT non-admin users don't "see" router port on its external
network.

This change uses an elevated context instead of user context to enable
non-admins to create "external" extra-routes.

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: #1538767
Change-Id: I08b1d8586a4cd241a3589e8cb7151b77ab679124

commit_message:
Change the CinderISCSIHelper to lioadm

Previously we used to always set CinderISCSIHelper to lioadm from
the client. With [1] we aim at cleaning up the client from any
default so this change move the actual default into the templates.

1. Iabc94ad1cce6f1744429aca9f866a59a698f5680

Change-Id: I662e4b0e3cf909ec2583d087ca1d246715caf0f7
Related-Bug: 1554564
(cherry picked from commit 7f2bca677bbffdd1a3031709fcc9d6f0bac48bb7)

commit_message:
Fix iteration over network_providers

"networks_metadata" dictionary contains not only network providers.
So iteration over all it's keys is incorrect.

Related to blueprint support-dpdk

Configure nova to use custom scheduler filter

The dependency adds a new scheduler filter that is required for
predictable placement of nodes.  This simply configures Nova to
use the new filter.

Ops guide rst conversion

Just ran through pandoc, placed into source.

New tox env for building rst created, and assorted required files to
make sphinx happy.

convert correctly.

commit_message:
Update of CI Infra config files

CI Infra software was updated to latest version.
Current config files are outdated and non-working,
updating configs for:
	-jenkins jobs
	-nodepool
	-zuul
Structure of directories is also changed as required by
upstream CI Infra deployment scripts.

Change-Id: Iab8ff8c680b2e486f70f77b3a2ff69bd43f9b7c4

subject: Fix livemigrationutils wmi connection getter
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-11 09:51:57.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/utils/baseutils.py', 'os_win/tests/utils/test_baseutils.py'], 'message': "Fix livemigrationutils wmi connection getter

The BaseUtilsVirt constructor overides the _wmi_namespace template,
expanding it with the host it retrieves.

This causes issues to the livemigrationutils connection getter
as this relies on the _wmi_namespace attribute to build it's remote
WMI connection. This is a regression caused by this change:
Iaa68a4ccd333b9e23cc7c373571f34d56ca2857b

This patch fixes the issue by simply avoiding overriding this
attribute.

Change-Id: Ifdba8fb1dcf9bf428c4da40103f224a2714c6586
"}]
commit_message:
Fix livemigrationutils wmi connection getter

The BaseUtilsVirt constructor overides the _wmi_namespace template,
expanding it with the host it retrieves.

This causes issues to the livemigrationutils connection getter
as this relies on the _wmi_namespace attribute to build it's remote
WMI connection. This is a regression caused by this change:
Iaa68a4ccd333b9e23cc7c373571f34d56ca2857b

This patch fixes the issue by simply avoiding overriding this
attribute.

Change-Id: Ifdba8fb1dcf9bf428c4da40103f224a2714c6586

Updated to non-deprecated LOG.warning.
